channel.title: work on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in work on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Fun last lesson before vacation
item.description: Hide and Akiko from 7pm class each needed to make up some lessons, so stayed for the 8pm class featuring Misato and Tatsuya. I think it worked pretty well; they had not met each other, and they are all pretty much similar personalities so I figured they would get along fine. After self intros, most of the time they talked about Akiko’s challenging business trip to Hydrabad, India. Most of the rest of the time we talked about Hide’s work.

item.title: got AB webserver upgraded
item.description: I got AB’s server upgraded from unsupported Ubuntu 12 to Ubuntu 18. Now running PHP 7 instead of unsupported 5.6 Now running RDS instead of MySQL on EC2. Not yet running ALB, but AWS tech team is looking into why the application was sometimes throwing 502 errors when I routed requests through ALB.

item.title: Working today
item.description: (written 21:32 Wednesday 18 September 2019 JST) Headed toward home on Nambu Line now after waking up at 4:30 (after one sleep cycle) and doing my morning routine (write dreams, write gratitude, meditate, brush teeth, etc) then headed to work in Kawasaki for JB in Solid Square. Sayuri came about 15 minutes late and was the only student in attendance. Headed to JR Kawasaki afterward to meet やなさん but he ended up having to cancel for some reason.

item.title: class no-show at JB School
item.description: No students in my 6pm class here. And my most-common student in next lesson has called in that he will not attend. I’m gonna use this time to write a bit. I had been planning to talk to them about WTC 7 and stuff on the anniversary of Airplane Day. 19:39 No students in my 7pm class… 20:00 One student in 8pm class. We started the lesson talking about the typhoon and her plans to practice piano next Sunday for a rehearsal on September 22nd.

item.title: Got email working on AB test server
item.description: (written 19:52 Wednesday 11 September 2019 JST) On Monday I got email working with AWS SES. It was pretty much plug-n-play level of easy since I already had a site set up that had been using PHPMailer. But eff me I could not figure out what was different from the setup on our old server which was sending emails from itself using Exim no problem.

item.title: Early morning snooze before work
item.description: I slept on 南武 line from 登戸 to 川崎 station today. Nice to get a 57 minute sleep on a 30 minute trip. (The train sits in Noborito for 27 minutes before departing.) Early morning lessons on Wednesday are back after the summer break. I’ve been teaching here for some years, “wouldn’t mind” if the lessons were taken over by someone else. “Wouldn’t mind” in quotes because that was the phrase Eriko doublechecked with me to be true regarding the lesson.

item.title: today
item.description: 16:45 Friday 30 August 2019 JST Several different things on my day off today. Mostly related to work, where I realized the value of having a staging server with non-live data. “Ohhh that is right; I tested saving data as well..” when AB was like, “Um, where is the Azabujuban record?” which had been renamed to “Doraemon 5e5433a38e2b035689a75c9ed11ffb0e” Once I fixed all of those (about 8 different records) based on the old live DB which is still available at cli with mysql as root, I watched episode 3 of The Naked Director.

item.title: AB RDS AZ
item.description: 13:17 Thursday 29 August 2019 JST I got AB’s DB on RDS, but had it in a different AZ than the server (oops) which caused some slowness that AB noticed. I turned on Multi-AZ and rebooted the RDS instance with “failover” selected and now AB’s RDS in AB’s EC2’s AZ makes it noticably faster. Yay!

item.title: worked at SCC
item.description: 16:58 Thursday 18 July 2019 JST Today Naoko worked on introducing the history zone, including teacup carrying dolls, perpetual clock, and the early days of electricity in Japan. What was it like back in the day when a simple thing like a few candle power light bulb could be so impressive? Yasu talked about the Meissner effect and flux pinning. I would like to do an experiment.. will the Meissner effect keep a thing suspended above the magnetic table or is that only do to flux pinning?

item.title: lesson in Akihabara
item.description: 19:51 Thursday 11 July 2019 JST Today there were only 1.5 students in my Akihabara class. This number is down from our high of like 8 last year when I had to stop checking homework during the lesson because there ended up being no time for class. I guess there would be time with just 2 students’ worth of homework. Anyway, the lesson kinda devolved into a China vs Japan debate.

item.title: lessons at SCC
item.description: 16:58 Thursday 11 July 2019 JST Interesting to talk about the Meisner effect and flux pinning at SCC today. I have always assumed I understand the meaning based on the English presentation, but I felt a bit unsure when I was breaking it down in detail for Yasu as he was practicing his explanation of the same. My understanding: when a superconductor is below its critical temperature it pushes (almost) all magnetic flux out of itself.

item.title: longer than ya think
item.description: 18:35 Wednesday 03 July 2019 JST Today I wanted to write an email to AB as a status update on the upgrade I am doing for them. The update has been taking longer than expected, both in terms of the amount of work required and the amount of time I have not been able to spend on it. To write the email, I wanted to make sure my plan will work.

item.title: super tired
item.description: 00:03 Tuesday 02 July 2019 JST Well, I missed the first day of the month by 3 minutes. I have been zoned out in front of my computer longer than 3 minutes so oh well. Logged 6 hours of work and noticed how much longer it will take. At 10 minutes per line, and 400 more lines to change that’s 4000 minutes (hopefully max!), but that is just to get rid of a single singleton.

item.title: Fun 3rd of 4th lesson at BP
item.description: 00:03 Friday 21 June 2019 JST JB got me 8 hours of lessons at BP over the 4 Thursdays in June. This was the 3rd lesson, during which we practiced taking taxis, ordering in a restaurant, and something else. Yoko M wasn’t there, but she will be back next week. Yoko N volunteered a couple of times to go first!

item.title: I got a seat on the train
item.description: 06:17 Monday 17 June 2019 JST I got a seat on my preferred train. I arrived in just enough time, though it’s reasonable to say I could have ridden more slowly to be safer (down the big-ass whooo-hooo hill).

item.title: Headed to see my Babychan
item.description: 20:20 Thursday 09 May 2019 JST Lin said she had an “unbelievably hard day at work today” so I look forward to listening and hopefully helping her sort out her feelings on the whole thing. New job, new system, steep learning curve; I can relate!

item.title: lesson in Akihabara
item.description: 20:18 Thursday 09 May 2019 JST Today I showed students in Akihabara the website and snippets for Marble Track 3. They were like “waow” etc. I love the project and felt a bit guilty for taking up a significant amount of class time with it. We have had lessons for years though, so I don’t think they will mind.

item.title: great lessons at SCC
item.description: 17:19 Thursday 09 May 2019 JST Four lessons at SCC today. One was shorter than expected due to a (hopefully small) medical emergency. Third lesson on the third floor featured discussions of the other three lessons and hearing they students really enjoy my passion for the topics.

item.title: Work at SCC
item.description: 20:34 Thursday 18 April 2019 JST Back at SCC today with four student for 30 minutes each. Hitomi came in for Lily, who could not come. I bought Cast Arrows, a new Hanayama puzzle because I could not solve it in 20 minutes. (not that I can solve most of them in 20 minutes, but this one looked like I could solve it and then I was like “woah that’s not going to work?

item.title: last lesson with Sweets Party Attendants
item.description: 21:33 Wednesday 06 March 2019 JST Today was the last lesson with Sweets Attendants. (Their office is being shut down at the end of this month, but I am leaving next week for three weeks overseas.) I met Tomoko at CPK at 11am and helped her carry pizza to their office where we had a party, including candy I bought from the conveni ond 3F. The party was fun, but afterward I unfortunately let myself get sidetracked into dealing with some work related Excel spreadsheet crap, but got it sorted out by moving the spreadsheet into Google Sheets, where I can use the =FILTER() function.

item.title: lessons in Akiba
item.description: 17:33 Thursday 21 February 2019 JST Now I am headed to Akihabara for lesson with Mayumi and them.

item.title: lessons at SCC
item.description: 17:29 Thursday 21 February 2019 JST Today (and most Thursdays) I taught at SCC in Kawasaki. Naoko reviewed for her test next week. Yasu reviewed the same material for his test sometime in the future. Azusa did much better with her fluency and intonation for her presentation. Liliko asked about the brochure that has to change soon to accomodate new opening times. After the lessons I went to say HI to Tomoko and Midori, but Midori had the day off.

item.title: work is going faster with tests
item.description: 10:23 Monday 18 February 2019 JST Although I have not gotten all the way to the part of MLAPHP that we are supposed to be adding tests, I am close enough that I can add some tests. They have helped a lot, like OMG how did I live without tests? It hasn’t been so long that I don’t remember what it was like, and I sure like this better.

item.title: lessons today
item.description: 21:30 Wednesday 13 February 2019 JST In the first adult lesson at JB, we flexed some reported speech muscles with Side By Side book 1, where the target language is “This is a photograph of my son Bart. He is riding a skateboard outside our house.” We changed it to be “This is a photograph of me riding a skateboard in from of my house” and then “That is a photograph of him riding a skateboard in from of his house.

item.title: Second to last lesson with Sweets Party Attendants
item.description: 21:26 Wednesday 13 February 2019 JST Sweets Party Attendants had their second to last lesson with me today. The mood was both somber and joyful; it has been great working with them over the years.

item.title: State of My Life Address
item.description: 07:44 Wednesday 06 February 2019 JST Lin and I still have our cat Jennie, still keep her in at night, still live in Asao-ku near the bottom of a hill. I’m still working on Marble Track 3, trying to do at least 2 hours of livestream per week. I have been working on AB, getting tests added to cover the important parts of the codebase. I do not have a lot covered, but 10 tests is an order of magnitude more than 0.

item.title: crontab -e as root vs sudo crontab -e [solved]
item.description: 21:10 Monday 21 January 2019 JST I had a weird issue with crontab today. If I editted the crontab while logged in as root, it did not work. $# whoami root $# crontab -e ((( make edits ))) crontab: installing new crontab But the changes did not work. $# exit $ whoami ubuntu sudo crontab -e ((( make edits ))) crontab: installing new crontab And the changes work just fine.

item.title: life changing work
item.description: 18:02 Thursday 17 January 2019 JST It has taken me a long time to reach this point, but from being afraid of men in 1997, I am now facilitating deep emotional work in men’s circles every week, both online and face to face in Tokyo. I want to deepen my skills as a facilitator and have decided to step more fully into this emotional awareness work. To improve my facilitation skills, I plan to staff two (2) New Warrior Training Adventure weekends, back to back in March and April.

item.title: work today
item.description: 22:00 Wednesday 16 January 2019 JST tired 8am - 9am Shukoh, then 4 hours of AB in internet cafe, TY called in the middle, then JB lessons from 3:30 to 9pm

item.title: work and prep work
item.description: 13:55 Thursday 10 January 2019 JST One of the AB cronjobs has been throwing errors, but the job is still running. I am in the middle of refactoring the code to use Dependency Injection; I don’t know how I broke something, but I cannot really go back to a previous version. Rather, I don’t know what version to go back to, and my local dev environment cannot recreate the error.

item.title: today workin
item.description: 20:42 Wednesday 09 January 2019 JST Today was a long day, starting with recording a first draft of a video for my first GoFundMe campaign, then two TY lessons, two MKP meetings, lunch with Tomoko, then an hour chillin with “a flower in each hand” behind the desk of the Sweets Party Attendants, having a non-lesson with them because they have nothing going on. During this non-lesson, Tomoko showed me her “personal こたつ” which consisted of a heater under her desk and a blanket strategically arranged to drape down over her legs.

item.title: last Akihabara lesson this year
item.description: 20:22 Thursday 20 December 2018 JST We had our last lesson of the year in Akihabara today. This is also Toshie’s last lesson so we had a party in her honor with all her favorite snack foods.

item.title: Closing out 2018
item.description: 21:30 Wednesday 19 December 2018 JST I am on the way home after my last 2018 lesson at JB. I thought we had lessons next week, but apparently not! I kinda sorta wish we did have to work next week; the monies would be nice, but I guess I can work on AB during that time.

item.title: today
item.description: 21:58 Wednesday 05 December 2018 JST Yikes I derped and did not do my task for TY. First time, but I will definitely not miss again. JB classes were fun; we used fake money notes as money in the 4:30pm kids class (Suzu, Kanta, Toshiro), and then I used them again in 8pm adult class (Misato, Kaori). Working on ConSwi now, refactoring to make pieces move themselves down, and get a ton of code out of the main Game.

item.title: today
item.description: 17:24 Thursday 29 November 2018 JST Just finished four lessons at SCC: Naoko, Liliko, Hitomi, and Yasu each had 30 minute lessons, practicing various parts of their presentations. During the first two lessons, my nose was running like yuck. I used a bunch of toilet paper and tissues blowing all the snot out. This morning I worked on MT3 for 1.5 hours or so, getting maybe 8 frames taken. At this point, I am working on version 2 of the website, which focuses on the characters making the track instead of me making the characters make the track.

item.title: Too busy
item.description: 21:10 Wednesday 14 November 2018 JST I can basically tell how busy I am by how much time I (don’t) spend writing in my journal. Inverse relationship between entries and busy. It’s not surprising, but just a thing to note. Recently, my “journaling” has included Marble Track 3 website, and that has included revamping the website a bit.

item.title: AB site progress
item.description: 22:03 Wednesday 07 November 2018 JST I have been upgrading AB’s PHP to the standards described in Paul Jones’ Modernizing Legacy Applications in PHP. So far I am still in the Autoloading section, but have done nearly half of the classes. Almost all of the “data” classes are done, but none of the search or factory classes are done. (I put data in quotes above because I think that is just a name we came up with .

item.title: Hanayama Marble at Wednesday morning lesson
item.description: 09:16 Wednesday 31 October 2018 JST The lessons I teach on Wednesday morning used to be on Thursday mornings. They were one of the first lessons I taught for JB. Pretty convenient when Lin and I lived near Kawasaki station, but now it takes over an hour to go each way for an hour lesson. Once I win the lottery, this will be one of the first lessons I release because I have to leave the house by 5:45 to get a seat on the train on the way there (or leave by 6:15 and stand for 40 minutes total on (two) trains).

item.title: worked on AB
item.description: 17:37 Tuesday 30 October 2018 JST Still going through MLAPHP for the AB project. I guess I am about halfway through the step of naming all the class definition files so they can be loaded via the autoloader. During this process I found Mabl which features a short domain name and some tools for automated testing. Pretty easy onboarding, and they are giving the site a good onceover every day.

item.title: training ty
item.description: 17:35 Tuesday 30 October 2018 JST Helped with training at TY’s today. Onboarding new instructors is a learning process in itself.

item.title: Confirmed no meeting
item.description: 15:36 Monday 15 October 2018 JST I will work on MLAPHP AB instead.

item.title: Mondays are early days
item.description: 14:25 Monday 15 October 2018 JST On Mondays for the past year or more, I have been waking up at 5am on Mondays to work at IL for an hour from 8am to 9am. Today we talked about the new fish market in Toyosu, and how at 40 hectares, it is 1.7 times larger than the fish market that was in Tsukiji (which I never visited during the fish auctions).

item.title: too busy for me
item.description: 13:38 Thursday 11 October 2018 JST I did MT3 livestream today, but have not made time to add an episode. I attended online men’s circle this morning, but was distracted with emails. Kevin’s website is throwing memory errors, probably because old version of site needs upgrading. I contacted his provider about getting it upgraded. I am on the train headed to SCC, but forgot to bring my tea cup so I probably have to use a paper cup (or go without tea).

item.title: working at work
item.description: 18:29 Wednesday 10 October 2018 JST No students in my lesson today so I am glad I brought my computer so I can do some work for AB. I am continuing with the Modernization of my Legacy PHP application based on the book described at https://mlaphp.com Modernize Your Legacy PHP Application Get your code under control in a series of small, specific steps. by Paul M. Jones In addition to simplifying the code, it has given me a refresher on what I wrote!

item.title: productent
item.description: 23:25 Tuesday 09 October 2018 JST Today wasn’t as productive as I had planned, but I got some good stuff done. 4:30am meeting with Boysen, and should have a landing page for The Men’s Work soon. 8:00am IL lesson in which we talked about Tsukiji and 2020 Olympics https://the-japan-news.com/news/article/0004879769 came home to work on MT3, but ended up just sleeping 7:00pm Tokyo Men’s Circle https://tokyo.mypowercircle.org/ 8:06pm someone killed themselves in Seijogakuenmae (a station along my train line)

item.title: learning PHP
item.description: 07:10 Sunday 07 October 2018 JST I have started going through Modernizing Legacy Applications in PHP for AB website, and now the database is loaded via an autoloader. <?php /** * This file is part of "Modernizing Legacy Applications in PHP". * * @copyright 2014-2016 Paul M. Jones <pmjones88@gmail.com> * @license https://opensource.org/licenses/bsd-license.php BSD */ /** * Autoloads classes. * */ namespace Mlaphp; class Autoloader { public function load($class) { // strip off any leading namespace separator from PHP 5.

item.title: met with Paul about The Men's Work
item.description: 19:53 Friday 05 October 2018 JST Exciting MKP Tokyo news! I sent this to my online Integration Group. I just got confirmation: I will be co-facilitating a 3-week online MKP introduction called The Men's Work https://mkpusa.org/themenswork/ with Paul Newell, who is currently co-facilitating it in the US. On Fridays, 7pm - 8:30pm (Japan time), November 3rd, 10th, and 17th, we will do this online training for men in Tokyo. Once we run this 3 week series of meetings a couple of times, I will create a new men's circle in Gotanda (Tokyo) on Fridays for men who are interested.

item.title: refactor
item.description: 08:27 Friday 05 October 2018 JST I found a solution to all my work woes. I just had an interesting thought about my computer job, which I brought up in the meeting on Monday. My website client is AB. It is likely that I can find a company that can do the work I am doing for less money, but it's not possible to secretly act as a middle man and keep the money due to how payments are done now.

item.title: progress on multiple fronts
item.description: 21:12 Saturday 22 September 2018 JST BH set up a Slack space for MKP Japan where we can discuss creating the organization and setting up some trainings. I got a multi-month fix done for AB; now users can use the same filter on their custom list page as they can on the main list. I don’t recall why it was set up this weird way before, but it is better now.

item.title: wednesday
item.description: 23:05 Wednesday 19 September 2018 JST (written 14:06 Thursday 20 September 2018 JST) Wednesdays are usually long for me. Wake up at 5am (after getting home no earlier than 10:30pm after men’s group, but Tuesday night I went to The Pink Cow (great to see Traci after I have been away so long!) for an event for hemp oil that Rohini invited me to attend. Anyway, got home Tuesday night at like 1:15am to find Lin sleeping on the couch and then showered so had 3.

item.title: morning lessons
item.description: 12:19 Tuesday 18 September 2018 JST Good lesson this morning with just two students. We talked about rental おっさん in Japan. Interesting concept of renting old men because they are older and presumably wiser. They? We? Walked with Tariq from Akabanebashi to Shibashi while we talked about future plans for our swipe game. He found a designer who can create excellent graphics. Did not end up needing my computer, but I have my rolly bag so no worries.

item.title: egad working all day on AB
item.description: 23:02 Saturday 25 August 2018 JST I hope I can get paid for this scope creep.

item.title: lesson via phone
item.description: 20:16 Sunday 12 August 2018 JST Today Lin and I are at her sister’s house, but they do not have strong wifi so I cannot use Skype. At least not in this quiet room. Maybe that is why it’s quiet haha. I do not have unlimited data on my phone, but I do have unlimited calling, so I am doing a lesson via phone instead of Skype.

item.title: headed to work
item.description: 13:00 Wednesday 08 August 2018 JST Headed to JB now soon; hopefully no big concern from the typhoon. I will bring my rain coat, but I ain’t too worried. 21:35 Wednesday 08 August 2018 JST The typhoon has been like a typhoon for ants. But my train is nearly empty because apparently nobody came to work. Or at least everyone left work early. I’m just finishing work and heading home now.

item.title: moe joe work
item.description: 22:39 Monday 16 July 2018 JST Bah. I’ve been working for like 12 or 16 hours trying to figure out how to keep a button visible, but I cannot figure out this spaghetti of code, domains, css, and browsers to figure out what is hiding it.

item.title: tired after long day
item.description: 22:44 Monday 18 June 2018 JST 5am woke up. Home just a bit ago. Tired long day. IL Lesson Wendy’s Wild Rock and Happy Dad’s day with Dad and Fred and Saundra on the line. UG Lesson Saizeria for lunch ooops no cash. wrote my name and number; went to the bank; came back and paid. Hung out with cats until time for co-gender circle. Co-gender circle. 3 people in attendance, including me.

item.title: work and work
item.description: 21:34 Wednesday 13 June 2018 JST Been working too much recently, but not enough to trigger carpal tunnel issues again, fortunately. Today for AB I nearly finished a report that AB wants to have available. I thought I could finish in 2 hours, but it has taken 6.5 so far. fack. I will tell them it has taken longer. Today for JB I did my normal Wednesday schedule (Solid Square with Ayano and them, then two kid lessons and two adult lessons in JB office from 15:30 - 21:00).

item.title: work
item.description: 21:33 Wednesday 06 June 2018 JST I worked for JB at three different locations around Kawasaki Station today, as I do every Wednesday, at Solid Square, SSC, and JB main office. Solid Square lesson went pretty well; we drew mind maps of our favorite places and then said a few sentences about them. Then I had a break during which I Marco Poloed with Richard from ae911truth a bit and then worked on AB, nearly finishing this ticket since it received a bit higher priority at our last meeting.

item.title: (teaching) today
item.description: 23:03 Wednesday 30 May 2018 JST On Wednesdays, I wake up at 5am and leave the house at 5:45am so I can get on a train that arrives in Noborito at 6:29am but leaves Noborito at 6:57am. That gives 58 minutes of sleeping time on the train including both waiting and riding to Kawasaki. Then lesson in Solid Square with Ayano, Takato, Yohei, Ai, and I talking about reasons we (dis)like certain months or seasons.

item.title: All day in park
item.description: 21:57 Sunday 20 May 2018 JST Great day at a park, but there were briars in the grass. Got to talk to Aaron for quite a bit and catch up with Francine who invited him. My student Misato attended and joined our little outing to find a nearby geocache which she was actually the one to find. I napped for 30 minutes in the tent that went largely unused.

item.title: worked on AB
item.description: 20:35 Saturday 28 April 2018 JST Good some good shiz done for AB today. Ran a DB update last night, and this evening added some calculated fields to a page. That was easy enough, but adding them to the output reports will take a bit more time to figure out.

item.title: worked with Mitsue on getting my sheet done
item.description: 20:33 Saturday 28 April 2018 JST Got some good sheet done on my speaker bio sheet from Soness’s course Build Your Speaker Bio and Media Sheet. Thank you Mitsue for your help!

item.title: Got some AB done today
item.description: 18:18 Thursday 26 April 2018 JST 22:39 Thursday 26 April 2018 JST haha I forgot to write anything.

item.title: working on mobile app
item.description: 10:44 Thursday 26 April 2018 JST Woke up early to come out to Kawasaki so I could meet with Oriane, Cyber Knights, and Court of Support before meeting Tariq at 11:30. We’ll have a good chunk of time (per my schedule) though I do not know how much time he will have. I plan to get some app stuff or AB done today.

item.title: got 3.5 hours of work done today
item.description: 18:41 Wednesday 25 April 2018 JST World record for me recently. Not counting 6 hours of lessons, of course. 06:31 Thursday 26 April 2018 JST And then an hour last night, even after getting home and Talking with Lin for a bit.

item.title: good lesson before holidays
item.description: 09:57 Monday 23 April 2018 JST Good lesson at IL this morning, though only two students attended. I praised the student who came 35 minutes late to thank her for attending even though it was apparently a challenge to join. Next week’s lesson is canceled due to a week of holidays, so on May 7th, I will invite them to talk about their holidays in English.

item.title: easy lessons
item.description: 17:37 Wednesday 18 April 2018 JST Easy lessons today because Patrick was out. After combining the 4:30 classes, we played a game with target language “May I have a card, please?,” “I’m ＿＿＿＿-ing,” “We’re ＿＿＿＿-ing,” “Hey ＿＿＿＿, let’s go ＿＿＿-ing,” and “Sorry I can’t. I’m busy.” Matt is also out today, so I’ll teach his 6pm lesson.

item.title: today
item.description: 10:22 Wednesday 18 April 2018 JST New regular students in SS lesson this morning; Kaede stopped coming relatively soon after joining last year, and Chika apparently took my bitcoin advice (whereas I did not haha) so she moved overseas. Satoshi has not come recently, and Sayuri said she was busy today, plus said Ayano something something so could not come. Nonoka and Ai came today. Ai helped Nonoka with some phrases and months of the year.

item.title: technical debt
item.description: 16:37 Friday 13 April 2018 JST I gotta figure out how to make the AB project go more smoothly. one: The system was designed to work with Customers logging in to the frontend, and Admin logging into the backend. two: A couple years ago, Admin asked if there is a way for SuperCustomers to log into the front end. three: I had to adjust the way people log into the site to allow them to be either Customers or SuperCustomers four: On the backend, I adjusted the way Inquiries were created because Customers and SuperCustomers will both need Inquiries five: Now I need to adjust the way Sets are created (Redmine ticket 3167) and I thought it would take 2 hours six: Oh crap it is taking way more than 2 hours to do correctly, because it affects how Customers are created, which is new, due to step 3 Fortunately, Nate understands, but it will take a while to do much about it.

item.title: last lesson this session
item.description: 14:21 Monday 09 April 2018 JST Today was the last lesson for Ushigoro. We had finished up everything last week, having done their exams, so today we just did lots of Q and A sessions, first with the class split into two groups, and then with all students asking questions of one student. I offered my LINE QR code in case they want to ask questions or continue practicing their English.

item.title: super sidetracked
item.description: 12:54 Friday 30 March 2018 JST Actually have gotten three (3) meetings done online: Prentiss and Ari helped with Mankind Project Tokyo; Ari said he will write some stuff for either Mankind Project Tokyo Meetup or My Power Circle. Oriane and I checked in with each other on our respective projects. Planning to ask which inkan I can use for my personal seal today; maybe I will go do that now on my way to work at TY.

item.title: work
item.description: 13:31 Thursday 22 March 2018 JST Right now I am in a coffee shop in Lazona, and about to go to SCC lessons for 3 hours, and then GG lesson for 1 hour. 18:02 Thursday 22 March 2018 JST Tears were apparently shed by one of the students at SCC; she is scheduled to present tomorrow and found out today that her presentation is going to be different than what she expected/practiced for.

item.title: Getting https working on AB
item.description: 15:43 Monday 19 March 2018 JST Nice to see setting up SSL certificates for Apache 2 on Ubuntu is pretty easy. They even automagically set up a cron job to renew the certificate after two months. See /etc/cron.d/certbot I had a problem for a minute because one .conf file had a domain and an alias in it. I ran certbot for the aliased domain and told it to go ahead and force https, but then that broke the main domain (which was the main domain) by forcing SSL and using the certificates for the test domain.

item.title: today
item.description: 18:16 Thursday 08 March 2018 JST Today I spent the morning setting up a test image upload page to see why I can’t get the main page to work via https. Frustrating: the test page is working fine. Working, I was distracted from online integration group, and then zoned to SCC and found out the manager is leaving soon. Now in Akihabara about to go to GG lesson.

item.title: trying to get SSL working on cloudfront (not solved)
item.description: 15:24 Friday 02 March 2018 JST We have an image server behind cloudfront. Cloudfront can serve everything via https when using its subdomain. But using our own domain with https isn’t as easy as I would like. Running Lets Encrypt on the server, I get an error like the https request was not allowed. So I created a certificate with AWS Certificate Manager and told Cloudfront to use it, but I do not see how to tell the server to use it.

item.title: on track to finish entire list
item.description: 14:18 Thursday 01 March 2018 JST I am on track to finish my todo list today on Complice. I got my AB work complete, though there is the possibility they will want one more change on it. I am prepared for work tomorrow and now just gotta write this journal entry, studying Japanese, work tonight, Japanese lesson tonight with Mel, .. I watched episode 6(?) of Kakegurui. They did not have the subtitles added yet, but I could understand the overall meaning because the acting is so over-the-top, plus explained visually (given that it’s a tv show)

item.title: work work work
item.description: 18:36 Wednesday 28 February 2018 JST I’m on break now at JB, listening to the other class, where the teacher’s Japanesey English always kinda bugs me. But the students seem happy and have been in the class for a long time. This morning thinking about C who apparently took my investment advice before bitcoin blew up. She quit her job and is overseas now. hahahah nice! Then working on AB, getting three alleged issues sorted.

item.title: Workin late
item.description: 23:52 Saturday 24 February 2018 JST This is taking longer than I guessed, but I got some tangential stuff cleared up, including a hardcoded value whose welcome has expired. "unit_id", meet record->id_field_name In other news, I randomly saw and later chatted with Hana today.

item.title: work work work all day
item.description: 22:47 Friday 23 February 2018 JST Sigh. Worked on AB all morning and then they were essentially like “yeah we don’t like it. Go back to the version that didn’t function, but looked pretty.” I don’t understand their priorities, but I switched it back.

item.title: work day
item.description: 16:21 Tuesday 13 February 2018 JST Worked at IL for ist today, and then with CE for MR, and then talked to Chika at B for JB. Now going to AB to talk to T and S-san. Tired, I would rather go home. Oh, but I got past the tween issue I had with Godot 3 Yay!

item.title: headed to BRIDGE
item.description: 13:49 Tuesday 06 February 2018 JST This is the fourth to last lesson at BRIDGE. They started off strong, but then started to get busy quite quickly last summer. Two hours of lessons went down to 1 hour which sucked considering it took 3 hours round trip travel. But I kept at it. During December they cancelled January saying they will be too busy. So I had a nice break during January, during which they said the will end at the end of February.

item.title: work
item.description: 19:51 Friday 02 February 2018 JST Yikes my previously-used JQuery CDN isn’t responding so I replaced it and now the main page of the site breaks. When did that start happening? What do I do? How do I find someone to take over this site? (that is my real question / I do not want to maintain it forever)

item.title: AB work
item.description: 17:23 Monday 29 January 2018 JST Had a good meeting with T at AB today. Nate got me the information I needed before the meeting and everything went well. Got them a new account set up and on Wednesday night I will transfer their server from our account to theirs.

item.title: headed to work at SCC
item.description: 12:55 Friday 26 January 2018 JST Three hours of lessons in SCC today; looking forward to it! On the way there, I hope to figure out why my local version of mypowercircle.org will not compile with Hugo. bah. it was supposed to be easy!! Ah. I had gotten stuck trying to add Japanese language version of the site, but never got it working. It’s better to just have an actual Japanese speaker make the Japanese site, so I cut out the Japanese content from the site and now it’s working again.

item.title: work
item.description: 18:34 Wednesday 17 January 2018 JST First three classes were fine today, though I have been asked to blow through a book super fast to let one class catch up with another class. I don’t think that’s how it works. In other news, JB has a new owner, who seems nice enough that I can keep working here. Really curious as to how much they paid!

item.title: work yesterday
item.description: 08:39 Tuesday 16 January 2018 JST I worked for four companies yesterday. First was my lesson in Akabanebashi for Tariq. Then walked to Nishi Azabu for MR Laboratories client (company DNE yet). Then walked across the Nishi Azabu intersection to a lesson for TESS. Then bus and train to Kawasaki for 2 hours of lessons at my favorite, SCC. Came home and had one more lesson for MR Laboratories.

item.title: five hours of work at SCC
item.description: 02:33 Saturday 13 January 2018 JST Today was the first time I worked five hours at SCC. Due to a schedule snafu, 1.5 hours with Liliko chatting about her trip to Sydney and my trip to OZ, then Rick and Morty and Lucifer. I didn’t think of Dirk Gently, but she considered getting Netflix to see the others.

item.title: Akihabara for GG lesson
item.description: 18:02 Thursday 11 January 2018 JST Now I am in Akihabara, across the street from GG lesson which starts at 18:30. I bought a trackball mouse to replace the one I had before which seems to just mysteriously and annoyingly not work anymore. This time I will keep the receipt because I think the old one konked out before its warranty was up.

item.title: two hour lesson with Tomoko
item.description: 17:59 Thursday 11 January 2018 JST Today was the first of five 2-hour lessons this month at SCC. Today I helped Tomoko by making corrections to her written English. She plans to present the features of some of her company’s products. Pretty cool stuff like elevators and batteries, and elevators that run on batteries. We studied up in their cafeteria on the 4th floor, and then I went down the escalator to the third floor and went out the exit I had never gone out before (but had seen many times).

item.title: getting back to work in 2018
item.description: 08:44 Wednesday 10 January 2018 JST I worked yesterday for the first time in 2018. Monday was a holiday, and my 13:41 Wednesday 10 January 2018 JST I am on the train and the above is as far as I got before sidetracking myself with something before having a meeting with TY at 9am then lunch with Lin. Today: I got my AWS account switched to JPY instead of USD so I can pay more efficiently.

item.title: changed icon
item.description: 22:15 Thursday 14 December 2017 JST Nate asked if I can change the icon on the new site, and gave me a whole stack of icons for different Apple devices. I was like, “false” and just changed the existing ico file.

item.title: in Akihabara for last lesson of 2017
item.description: 17:54 Thursday 14 December 2017 JST After working 3 hours (5 lessons) near Lazona, I’m eating cold lunch in Akihabara across the street from GG lesson. I have Lin’s sister’s heavy-as-hell suitcase. (Now I know why gorillas cannot break them) 19:41 Lesson was great; everyone was there! Yoko, Maki, and Atusko all brought sweets! Mayumi and Toshie both did homework!

item.title: testing exim
item.description: 21:51 Wednesday 13 December 2017 JST exim -v thunderrabbit@example.com From: yoexim@example.com To: yoeximumad@example.com Subject: Testing Exim This is a test message. ‘twas delivered to spam, but it worked.

item.title: headed to last Sunday work this year
item.description: 07:51 Sunday 10 December 2017 JST Headed to Ty’s for the last Sunday working this year; he is closing up for the holidays, and may actually have some sort of family thing back in the states. Probably going to hang out with them afterward for dinner.

item.title: oops schedule
item.description: 14:30 Thursday 07 December 2017 JST (written 18:15 Thursday 07 December 2017 JST) While on the phone with BoA credit card to close my account, I got a call from JB: “hey yeah why aren’t you at work?” Stomach sank link oh damn are you kidding me? Turns out they hadn’t sent me the schedule for December, but I certainly could have been more proactive to check. I have set a reminder for the 28th of each month to make sure I have the dates in my calendar for the subsequent month.

item.title: students leveled up real quick
item.description: 17:47 Wednesday 06 December 2017 JST At my third of three kids classes here at JB, we had a new student, 4 or 5 years older than the others. The two previously-oldest girls in the class suddenly stopped messing around and tried significantly harder than usual. Such a nice change of pace! I used a technique I learned from Tariq: keep having them switch conversation partners and repeat the same conversation with a new partner.

item.title: just finished the work I wanted to do this weekend
item.description: 19:44 Sunday 03 December 2017 JST Nate hasn’t set the Name servers for this domain the way he said he would, but I guess he understands the consequences.

item.title: sb work before work with Ty
item.description: 09:01 Sunday 03 December 2017 JST Been working all morning on sb new admin site. I got it deployed and essentially working last night. Now need to deploy the API, which should be way less work. Nate still has not set the Nameservers though so even when I get it finished, he won’t be able to see it (unless he sets up local /etc/hosts file) Going to meet Ty soon to figure out this protocol we are developing.

item.title: work
item.description: 16:22 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST Been working on SB pretty much all day. 20:23 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST All day, though I meditated for 20 minutes and watched Season 2 episode 1 of Lucifer and Season 3 episode 1 of Rick and Morty (for the nth time).

item.title: work
item.description: 16:22 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST Been working on SB pretty much all day. 20:23 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST All day, though I meditated for 20 minutes and watched Season 2 episode 1 of Lucifer and Season 3 episode 1 of Rick and Morty (for the nth time).

item.title: work
item.description: 16:22 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST Been working on SB pretty much all day. 20:23 Saturday 02 December 2017 JST All day, though I meditated for 20 minutes and watched Season 2 episode 1 of Lucifer and Season 3 episode 1 of Rick and Morty (for the nth time).

item.title: woke up early with no alarm
item.description: 07:00 Thursday 30 November 2017 JST I woke up at 4am with no alarm, and then actually got up at 4:26. Chatted with Jason and Jimmy for a second before getting to work. Work included getting Ansible to create directories for a SB website on AWS. Basically I am tweaking the playbooks and roles from AB website to work on SB website. I need to make them a bit more generalized, but to a degreee, I think they are pretty good.

item.title: SB DNS
item.description: 22:54 Wednesday 29 November 2017 JST 22:51 sb: What do u think is best? 22:51 me: It is best if you decide 22:51 me: The items I mentioned above I think are perfect 22:52 me: They make sense to me, and I think they will make sense to anyone who uses them. 22:52 me: I am worried that there may be some confusion about what you think is best. 22:53 me: I thought we had agreed at the cafe about which domain would be used for what purpose.

item.title: Chillin in Tullys
item.description: 15:55 Monday 20 November 2017 JST I’m getting back into Ansible groove on AWS. Thanks to Ansible for making it relatively easy to set up AWS boxes.

item.title: new style TS lessons
item.description: 17:56 Thursday 16 November 2017 JST Mutsumi introduced a new style lesson format where the guides sit down together with me instead of just having individual lessons. Hopefully this will help them improve listening skills by listening to other people have conversations in English. I showed mt3s.robnugen.com to Miyako and Ayaka. Miyako showed me pics from her trip to the US with Haruka.

item.title: today
playing with AWS for sbs.net
item.description: 12:27 Wednesday 15 November 2017 JST Not actually sbs.net, but yes actually AWS. Using Ansible again, thanks to Travis having suggested it to me. Right now as I write this entry, AWS my wifi in this cafe is being slow to realize that my VPC is already created. Not sure why, as it was fast a moment ago. Yep it just timed out. The error was: ssl.SSLError: The read operation timed out Previously, I was getting

item.title: late for class near C's place
item.description: 16:51 Monday 13 November 2017 JST TL;DR: Would you like donuts delivered to your place on Monday morning Nov 20th? details: Story time! Today I was inexplicably late for class which happens to be near your place. I told them I would get donuts before class next week. I found a donut place, checked Google Maps to see how to get to the class... and the track goes right by your house!

item.title: great meetings
item.description: 21:06 Monday 30 October 2017 JST Meeting was fine and then the next meeting was great! Actually first meeting was great and the second was awesome I was really worried about the first meeting and I didn’t even expect the second one to happen, so overall fantastic

item.title: meeting prepped I hope
item.description: 05:58 Monday 30 October 2017 JST CB wants a presentation about the API. I started to explain how an API works and they seemed to know that, but they wanted to know how it’s set up. I have answered in terms of what I know and I hope that is enough for them to be satisfied.

item.title: morning lesson
item.description: 09:13 Wednesday 25 October 2017 JST Good lesson today, full of the word “full of” and after filling the paper with examples, “this page is full”

item.title: Liz English School
item.description: 13:05 Tuesday 24 October 2017 JST Met Yaw for the first time at Liz English School. He and I got on quite well, and even shared a prayer for world peace and supporting our community and family. I look forward to working closely with him in the future.

item.title: meeting standby
item.description: 17:42 Wednesday 11 October 2017 JST 5:30pm meeting is underway, but I am only being asked questions via text while here at JB since they are doing it in Japanese (at CB). 17:47 I’m dialed in now. 17:51 They are asking how the API works. I explained it is like a web server which gives just data instead of data and HTML. They said they understand that, but how does it work?

item.title: lesson at TB
item.description: 13:54 Wednesday 11 October 2017 JST Good lesson today at TB; they had just redone the place so I got a grand tour of the show room. Midori talked to some clients while Tomoko gave me the tour. They didn’t have anything to check yet, but I saw lots of word-for-word translations which we will have to clean up later. They actually had to leave 10 minutes earlier than normal, so I headed out at 1:50pm.

item.title: 1 hour lesson at NB
item.description: (written 12:50 Friday 06 October 2017 JST) Worked at NB on Tuesday, my first lesson there that only lasted 1 hour. Boo. It was okay going all the way there for 2 hours, but just for 1 hour kinda sucks. I hope we can work out something else, like maybe they buy lunch as well.

item.title: first official NA lesson
item.description: 10:14 Monday 25 September 2017 JST NA is the two letter designation for a new lesson I will be teaching on Mondays. It is within walking distance of the Monday morning lesson, but there is a bit of a gap in between so I am chilling at a restaurant in Tokyo Tower. 15:35 Monday 25 September 2017 JST Lesson was tough at first when I tried terribly to explain my intention to the group of quietly patient students.

item.title: working on (shinkansen)
item.description: 06:51 Friday 15 September 2017 JST On the shinkansen from Shin Yokohama to Shin Osaka. First stop is Nagoya (I think), 72(?) minutes away.

item.title: ab work
item.description: 13:52 Thursday 14 September 2017 JST AB said something changed suddenly. git blame says in changed in April 2014. AB conceded but asked that I change it back to the way it was.

item.title: today
item.description: 23:57 Tuesday 12 September 2017 JST Just got home via taxi with Lin after eating ice cream with her near our station. I got Ben and Jerry’s cotton candy (which was similar to Baskin Robbin’s Popping Shower), and she got cherry by some other premium brand, the name of which escapes me now. Lin and I took the same train from Noborito to our station. She had gotten on near Shinjuku, and we did not specifically plan to take the same train, but it worked out that way.

item.title: extra lesson
item.description: 07:02 Tuesday 05 September 2017 JST I plan to start (continuing) working on Marble Track 3 now, slightly earlier than normal because I have an extra class to teach today.

item.title: guaranteed seat to Shinjuku
item.description: 05:26 Monday 04 September 2017 JST I have taken to takin’ the super express train to work on Monday mornings. I get a guaranteed seat for a 20 minute snooze instead of guaranteed standing room only for 30 minutes. Only problem is the schedule: I end up arriving 45 minutes early. However, I have never been late to this class, given that I attempt to arrive at least 20 minutes early.

item.title: plan for tomorrow
item.description: 21:28 Sunday 03 September 2017 JST 15-20 minutes: new student intro self, students ask questions, new student ask questions. (I write Time, Name, Job, Etc outline on left side and then old topics on board while questions are in progress) 15-20 minutes: students prepare to do a quick presentation (one line summary at least) on any topic 15-20 minutes: students give their presentation, starting with new student’s helper 15-20 minutes: move on to next topic

item.title: project management
item.description: 16:41 Friday 01 September 2017 JST One of my work projects has been in maintenance mode for years. https://www.beargroup.com/ideas/agile-web-development-our-approach-project-management mentions “wing it” and “agile” as two methodologies. We are definitely in the “wing it” column.

item.title: yikes stripes limited sleep coming right up
item.description: 01:48 Wednesday 30 August 2017 JST The past few entries are dated some hours after they happened, but this one is being written in real time. I gotta wake up in 3 hours. shit shit shit. Fortunately, I can sleep for a bit on the train. Unfortunately, I can only sleep for 50 minutes on the train and it usually leaves me groggy.

item.title: free lunch after lesson at NB
item.description: 01:40 Wednesday 30 August 2017 JST Today after teaching for 2 hours at NB, they offered me lunch! Yay! Today was Yusuke’s last day! Booo!! All the students seemed to enjoy the lesson! Yay!!

item.title: need to figure out email issue
item.description: 17:14 Monday 28 August 2017 JST aight I am going to dig in to why AB is not getting their email.

item.title: New Terms and Conditions
item.description: 17:09 Monday 28 August 2017 JST I called Apple Worldwide Support to ask why their docs say I need LaunchImages with sizes X, Y, Z, while an error message says I need a LaunchImage of size A. Their answer: accept the new Terms and Conditions and try my upload again. What?

item.title: ordered an AC
item.description: 18:44 Friday 11 August 2017 JST Welp, I gave in. But I like to think my computer gave in. There have been a couple of times this summer that I could not get work done because my computer overheated and refuxed to turn on or do things like accept keyboard / mouse input. My room gets a bit hot, even with windows open,.. and I realized recently, I have taken more naps because of my computer (and I) overheating, so it has actually affected my income.

item.title: lesson
internetty lesson
item.description: 09:07 Wednesday 26 July 2017 JST Lesson at Zavas featured a high level discussion of two different peering arrangements (p2p vs centralized) and the concept of protocols. I was planning to talk about Bitcoin, but the word “peer” in the whitepaper started the discussion we ended up having. I had a distinct sense of inadequacy when describing layers of protocols that make up the internet, but that may be because when I hear the phrase “the internet” in my mind, my mind replies with “the internet is made of cats, the internet is made of cats, cats!

item.title: Covered for Patrick 1 of 5
item.description: 20:06 Monday 24 July 2017 JST Worked at AK today for a 2 hour lesson. Pretty great because the students are all talkative and asked questions and such. Chatted a bit and then showed them an article I used with other class. This class had much higher comprehension of the article… which is good, but shows me just how too-high the article was for my other class. After the lesson, Eiko walked me back nearly to the security gate, asking about PB a bit.

item.title: weird work
item.description: 16:08 Monday 24 July 2017 JST For some reason, I cannot connect to an EC2 instance, but I can connect to its sibling which was created with same OS, security group,and ssh key. hmmm.

item.title: tweaked Kai's presentation
item.description: 14:15 Monday 24 July 2017 JST Met Kai today at 1pm to edit her presentation which she translated from Japanese. It was pretty decent actually, with just a few wonky sentence structures and some punctuation typos. It was so easy that it did not take the 2 hours we had allocated, but boom done in an hour sitting at (“Fresh like a box of _______ ______“) down near Azalea.

item.title: plan for tomorrow
item.description: 23:20 Sunday 23 July 2017 JST Plan for tomorrow: Have students sit at one table write words on board and have them make sentences walk around to offer support write their sentences on the board introduce the idea of who what where when why hand out document with wwwww examples have them practice making new sentences urban suburban rural potential roof gust struck residential complaint populated depopulated westernmost vacant abandoned municipalities elementary ceremony fiscal

item.title: work for sb
item.description: 22:33 Friday 21 July 2017 JST Just got a call from Nate to set up O to use the old CB CMS.

item.title: work for JL
item.description: 20:37 Friday 21 July 2017 JST I spoke to J at JL; it seems like it will be tough, but good.

item.title: today
item.description: 23:38 Wednesday 19 July 2017 JST Today while running to catch my preferred train, I stubbed my toe. It didn’t hurt all that much, but is just annoying that now I will have to wear shoes for a bit while it heals. I forgot to take a picture right after it happened, but I posted one on twitter tonight.

item.title: new lesson
item.description: 17:52 Tuesday 18 July 2017 JST Met new students for a first lesson in Nihonbashi. Five beginner students who all seem pretty genki. Some are more beginner than others. JB was there to do the introduction and everything went smoothly. See you guys again next week! “I’m glad to hear that!”

item.title: morning lesson
item.description: 9am Tuesday 18 July 2017 JST (written 17:54 Tuesday 18 July 2017 JST) Lesson at Il was okay but not great. I had what I thought was a good plan, but it resulted in silence during the latter half. Hmmm.

item.title: work waves
up early
item.description: 03:03 Sunday 09 July 2017 JST I set my alarm to wake up early this morning so I can get some work done while it’s not too hot in my room. When my computer gets hot, it gets slow. (Basically because it is old and the kernel task starts to go crazy and take all the CPU.)

item.title: work
item.description: 21:37 Saturday 08 July 2017 JST Having trouble getting work done for AB. I finished the one thing they wanted done, but cannot seem to figure out the thing I really want to do.

item.title: ab site fixes
item.description: 09:29 Friday 07 July 2017 JST Need to hopefully finish ticket 3135 today.

item.title: GG lesson
item.description: 21:42 Thursday 29 June 2017 JST Tonight I talked about Marble Track 3 during the lesson with GG. The next streaming video I do will be for them because 6 minutes before the lesson started, I realized I had purchased the wrong type of extension cable (the clerk tried to tell me but I did not understand what she said. 180 yen wasted and a new wire to get stuck in some fish’s gill because the shop does not accept returns.

item.title: cadence
item.description: 18:49 Wednesday 28 June 2017 JST Third lesson today was good; some of the students seemed to really enjoy the cadence practice we did, focusing on matching the natural native-speed rhythm of my speech. Finally I have found something that kinda gets their attention. Mental note duly noted. Maybe I will try it with my next class, but I kinda doubt it will have the same effect.

item.title: technical debt
item.description: 10:40 Wednesday 28 June 2017 JST The old code was this: $search_id = uniqid(UserAuthentication::getUserId()); Now it is this. switch ($report_id) { case '2': // I have no idea how to fix this one case '5': // contact edit page knows nothing of V2-style indices case '9': // contact edit page knows nothing of V2-style indices case '10': // uses `u` in query. See SELECT * FROM `defined_reports` WHERE `dr_id` = 10 case '11': // uses `t` in query case '13': // can probably fix if remove `u` from `query` SELECT * FROM `defined_reports` WHERE `dr_id` = 13 case '16': // can probably fix if remove `u` from `query` case '17': // can probably fix if remove `u` from `query` case '18': // can probably fix if remove `u` from `query case '19': // can probably fix if remove `u` from `query $search_id_version = 1; $search_id = uniqid(UserAuthentication::currentUserId()); break; default: $search_id_version = 2; $search_id = "v2-" .

item.title: weird last day at CB
item.description: 11:40 Monday 26 June 2017 JST It is weird because I have only heard from Nate that today is my last day with CB. I got a message saying “let’s hold off on the server upgrade until July” … but I am done today, as far as I know. It is so weird to not be able to speak directly about stuff. 13:07 Monday 26 June 2017 JST My contact had forgotten, but they know.

item.title: morning lesson
item.description: 09:05 Wednesday 21 June 2017 JST Just finished teaching and am now seated on a balcony walkway thing overlooking the empty water fountain in middle of Solid Square. The lesson featured drills on two different patterns. One student was like “I went to shopping” so we practiced variants of that pattern. Another student arrived and started talking about TV so we practiced a pattern like ______ is a _______ about _______ _____-ing ______ ____ __ _ _ _ _

item.title: worknt
item.description: 12:10 Monday 19 June 2017 JST Aint shit to do for CB now. Unless they have something I don’t know about. 15:06 Monday 19 June 2017 JST I am on the train now in Shinjuku. How is it they have more super-express trains that express trains? I guess they know what they are doing and it works out for me, so there’s my answer. Anyway, I texted CB 44 minutes after our normal meeting time.

item.title: CB is moving away
item.description: 12:17 Wednesday 14 June 2017 JST Today is the big day to move CB to new servers. I reset the master password after it became apparent that the normal user cannot dump the DB. CB was still not able to run mysqldump, so they ended up just getting a snapshot from their AWS RDS instance. I hope hope hope hope the transition goes smoothly. Today I have been giving some advice but not actually doing anything (except reset the master password) because I have not been made privy as to what exactly they want to do with the data.

item.title: Hopefully finished CB testing
item.description: 12:41 Monday 12 June 2017 JST Just finished going through the CB admin site and the CB staging site to look for any differences. I see some cases where functionality does not work, but both sites produce the same results, even in those non-working cases. Right now they are in a meeting and I feel fear because I cannot anticipate if they are going to be pissed because they think I did not follow their unwritten expectations or if they will say yeah nothing to do see you next week.

item.title: set up Twilio to call me in case of ...
item.description: 14:04 Monday 05 June 2017 JST We are in a kinda weird place with CB. They are moving to a new server / dev team. Fair enough. I knew it would not last fo-eva but as of now, I am updating their servers to new Ubuntu at the same time they are planning to shut down these servers in favor of different servers run by a different dev team.

item.title: lesson
item.description: 09:50 Monday 05 June 2017 JST I survived the lesson pretty genkily; we had a discussion about what it means to be Japanese, and of the original list from which we later culled about 2/3rds of the items, we had Japanese people believe they are Japanese grow up in Japanese school system like to wait in long lines watch NHK on New Year’s day are proud of Mt Fuji That last one intrigued me; I had not predicted it.

item.title: sorta kinda back on track
item.description: 14:43 Monday 22 May 2017 JST After having gotten the servers upgraded ahem (1⁄2 of) the servers, I no longer feel like I did for most of April and the first half of May, all panickly (*) like ohmygodicannottakeasinglebreak! (*) nice misspelling; I think I will leave it

item.title: still can't get shit done
item.description: 15:57 Thursday 18 May 2017 JST Today I discovered the image server had run out of space; I hadn’t created a separate volume for its cache. Got that sorted, but now need to add a cronjob to prune the space. I hope wiping files older than N days should do it, because that what I plan to do. But why tf are some images still showing up all FFFFFF white?

item.title: cannot login
item.description: 07:47 Thursday 18 May 2017 JST CB: Onece we logout,we can't login. CB: it's a app things. me: hmm. I have not changed the iPhone app.. the only thing I changed recently was the image server. me: I wonder what could cause it. Steps to check: Look up my username and password thunderrabbit / *********************************** see if I can log in if not, log in to server watch the logs see if there is an error if not, (shrug smiley) if so, hope the error tells me something 08:01 Thursday 18 May 2017 JST I was able to log in no problem.

item.title: blargh
item.description: 21:11 Wednesday 17 May 2017 JST What’s the polite way to say show me the money when my language school is like oh can you make these tweaks to our website? Lessons tonight were ssooo challenging for me.

item.title: can't get shit done
item.description: 12:25 Wednesday 17 May 2017 JST Man my productivity has been dismal for a while. Basically it’s cause I have too much shit going on and can’t keep the status of all my projects in mind. Specifically, I wasted an hour wondering why one particular image would not show up, and turns out I had not yet updated my dev environment to use the new image server. Then a tiny bit of maintenance success getting my dev environment fully working, but now it’s time to go to my next lesson.

item.title: Mt Fuji's 'recent' eruption
item.description: 09:19 Wednesday 17 May 2017 JST Today I learned from C-san that the southern face of Mt Fuji erupted in 1707, leaving a still clearly visible crater on the side of the mountain. So interesting!! A-san showed us a satellite map which shows the hole and a river-looking thing on another face of the mountain. I’m glad C-san remembered her homework!

item.title: snoozy commute
item.description: 06:25 Wednesday 17 May 2017 JST Arriving on time for my 7:50am - 8:50am lesson requires I leave our house by 6:25am. However, if I leave home by 5:45am, I can sit down on a train at 6:25am, and sleeeeep until it arrives at 7:30am.

item.title: work
item.description: 16:28 Monday 15 May 2017 JST Moe Joe. CB was like ‘um where are the images in our app?’ Turns out the app source hardcodes the image server domain name instead of reading it from the API the app uses. Spent 1.5 hours on phone with AWS support trying to get our domain pointed to CBs new image server. Ended up doing it at DNS level because I could not get redirects to work from the server.

item.title: good ness
item.description: 18:33 Monday 08 May 2017 JST TL;DR: wasted a lot of time today. Wall of crap: I somehow confused myself and my vagrant VMs. The big change I made was to recreate my ~/.ssh/id_rsa keys in my management box. That meant I could not connect to the other VMs until I put the public key in their .ssh/authorized_hosts file, which I did, but then I could not deploy the sites without giving the new key to bitbucket, and then I ended up destroying and recreating a VM because for some reason the “exact same” (*) deploys that worked before were not working because they were being run as ubuntu instead of vagrant.

item.title: FS for AB and CB
item.description: 09:32 Saturday 06 May 2017 JST After upgrading it to Ubuntu 14, I split the FS box into two, and put one on CB’s AWS account so they have control over it. (cough) and pay for it. The AB version we still pay for, but the load is much lighter.

item.title: Got AB their own FS
item.description: 14:32 Friday 05 May 2017 JST Since recovering from my little DB restore delimma, I have instantiated an instance of FS just for AB. I will move the existing FS instance to CB’s account so they can pay their own way.

item.title: no,no,no,no,no,yes
item.description: 11:27 Friday 05 May 2017 JST While trying to fix the backup process, I destroyed the database by overwriting with data from April 20th. Had a good cry, and now am restoring the data from a 1GB backup file. (It’s this file that I guessed would be troublesome in a restore process, so I wanted to break it up into bits. Now we get to do the restore starting with this file.

item.title: Productive X2
item.description: 20:54 Saturday 29 April 2017 JST Pretty much got everything sorted. I never got the old AB VM to have connectivity again, but my new AB VM is in better shape than the old VM ever was: The new VM can send emails can easily have deploys target specific branches uses domain names that differ from production by a single character (.cojp vs .co.jp) uses Ubuntu 14 is fully deployed via Ansible and that last item means if I lose my physical computer, I can pretty quickly recreate my development environment, at least as far as that VM is concerned.

item.title: back on track
item.description: 14:34 Saturday 29 April 2017 JST Well, I have recovered nearly to the point that I was 24+ hours ago before killing connectivity to my VM. I tried restoring the old VM, but didn’t get it working. It’s a non-issue at the moment. I have a new VM to which I can connect from my host (allowing SublimeText2 (Registered) to save files to it), and from a sibling guest VM which provisioned the new VM using Ansible.

item.title: TY, T!
item.description: 09:26 Saturday 29 April 2017 JST TL;DR: https://www.packer.io/ Travis gave a fantastic reply to my tale of disconnectivity. I am going to dive in to Packer for a few units of time, and then try to restore connectivity to my old VM, and then try to finish installing site on my new VM, and then try to do the update I wanted to do yesterday morning! 09:43 Saturday 29 April 2017 JST Okay, let’s install Packer!

item.title: productivent
item.description: 16:23 Friday 28 April 2017 JST Last night AB was like “hey we cannot send emails.” They got a 500 error because I forgot to enable mcrypt to create passwords for new users. Enabled mcrypt and manually fixed some shit that didn’t work due to the 500 error. Got everything sorted today and then ready to work but denied because the local VM in virtualbox does not have access to the internet.

item.title: working from home
item.description: 13:33 Thursday 27 April 2017 JST Now I am working from home, hoping to get test AB talking to test FS behind a load balancer and cdn.

item.title: lessons
item.description: 22:59 Wednesday 26 April 2017 JST Today’s first three lessons went really well by simply having a four part target per lesson: questions, text, test, game. Thanks, Yuji! I did a gamification of the questions portion of the lessons. For question correctly answered within about five seconds, the student received a “prize” (single card from Stacker Crackers). The cards give them something to fiddle with while other students are answering questions, and hopefully inspires them to answer correctly.

item.title: Got fake FS working on new server
item.description: 12:03 Wednesday 26 April 2017 JST Nice. Now that I’ve got a few Ansible playbooks set up (thanks, Travis!), it’s sorta kinda easy to spin up a new server with all its personalized packages, bells, and whistles. Today I got FS set up on a temporary server, including pulling a copy of the DB and static files from the live server. Basically, I need to split the live server into two: one that we can give to CB and one that we continue to use for AB.

item.title: oops and whew
item.description: 12:53 Tuesday 25 April 2017 JST I left the AB DB backup process in testing mode (backup every hour, do not clean up the files) and it killed the disk this morning and locked up the server. Thankfully, I was able to request support from AWS. They called me immediately and helped me dismount the flooded disk, remount it at /mnt on a different server where I was able to clean up the disk, then remount it on AB server and get the server running again.

item.title: work
item.description: 10:05 Monday 24 April 2017 JST Today I hope to get AB server upgrade officially complete. Need to clarify a time with client and then do it, hopin’ all goes smoothly (i.e. I have not missed anything).

item.title: slowly
item.description: 12:42 Saturday 15 April 2017 JST Man this is going slowly. Part of it is pain in my neck, wrists, head, fingers..

item.title: plan
item.description: 10:02 Friday 14 April 2017 JST Because it takes 5 hours to import the data in my reliable way, I will not recreate the machine from scratch in Tokyo region. I’ll finish it up in California and then move it over to Tokyo. steps add cron jobs Make sure site works change the domains to correct domains make an AMI of the box copy it to Tokyo spin it up copy latest data changes over point DNS to new box activate SSL Step One requires

item.title: 1 of 5 servers almost updated
item.description: 18:00 Thursday 13 April 2017 JST It looks like I’ve nearly got AB’s server rebuilt with new Ubuntu OS. I just need to put the crontab entries on it, and run it through all the tests. yay. CB’s two servers are close to being almost updated, but I just have not taken the time to do them. Glad they do not have to have mysql data on them. Just gotta deal with a big disk.

item.title: CB site
item.description: 23:58 Monday 10 April 2017 JST Wow the CB site is sooo much easier to deploy given that it does not have mysql data served from the same server.

item.title: weekend
item.description: 10:11 Monday 10 April 2017 JST This past weekend it rained, so SOGO was cancelled. I was kinda glad because I feel behind schedule on getting servers running with Ansible. I’ve abandoned jumping from Ubuntu 12 to Ubutnu 16 this time. I’m focusing on Ubuntu 14 with the hopes that having this groundwork laid (on the groundwork laid by Ansible), the next upgrade will be ready ahead of schedule.

item.title: Mornin
item.description: 07:54 Thursday 30 March 2017 JST I kinda wanna put an apostrophe on both sides of Mornin, to replace Good and g, but it seems weird no matter where I put them so bah. I woke up just before 5am this morning without my alarm oh man my student is here.

item.title: My desk will not attend my funeral
item.description: 10:54 Wednesday 29 March 2017 JST Too busy working to read this, but I bet it says I am too busy working https://medium.com/personal-growth/your-desk-will-not-attend-your-funeral-779515a81dd3

item.title: presentation lesson
item.description: 11:11 Monday 27 March 2017 JST This morning we reviewed last week’s article about Nissan having been selected to provide New York City taxi minivans until 2024. Talked about the benefits of the taxis from the points of view of different people: passengers, drivers, owners. Then we did mock sales presentations, tailored to our imaginary audiences.

item.title: thanks Dr Fred!
item.description: 22:23 Sunday 26 March 2017 JST Talked with Fred today for 6+ hours working on a backup script. When I tried to run it on all the tables, the resulting .tar.gz file was like 8GB and was hanging the machine when I tried to work with it. So I split the archive by years and got Fred to help me write a bash script to loop through the years of the data and bundle the tables up into more useably sized archives.

item.title: thank you, mobile office
item.description: 14:51 Wednesday 22 March 2017 JST At home, I set up a URL that I could reload repeatedly to process N records at a time. I logged in to the site on my phone and repeatedly loaded it while walking to the train station, and now while on the train, I just now used my phone’s wifi tethering option to rerun a CSV create script after all the records had been updated.

item.title: too late
item.description: 12:17 Tuesday 21 March 2017 JST Yesterday was a holiday, and happily enough, I basically took the day off. The previous two days I had been up working until an average of 4am. Today I just read HN and now about to work on Ansible playbooks again. But first, a silly thing I just made up: A: 鍵はどこかな? B: 車内じゃない？

item.title: workin
item.description: 13:36 Saturday 18 March 2017 JST Work work work gah

item.title: workin
item.description: 09:06 Saturday 25 February 2017 JST Now about to work on worky work work to fix the issue that I triaged last night by setting up old code on staging server. It’s interesting that these different issues are coming up now when I’ve got other projects already going for same client.

item.title: work
item.description: 23:04 Friday 24 February 2017 JST I just found out that the Big Change I made to clients website last month broke some important functionality that I didn’t have an automated test set up to catch the mistake. Now am putting an old version of the code on test website so they can use the old version for the old functionality .. basically supporting two websites for them (well 3, counting the frontend) while I fix the code to work with new data structure.

item.title: workin
item.description: 05:54 Monday 20 February 2017 JST Though I went to SOGO yesterday (and had a great time), I have been working too much. My pinky still hurts, but less now that I use it less. My shoulders are tense.. perhaps I should switch my mouse to left hand again. But, I have now gotten Redmine installed via Ansible, and another website installed on same server. Still need to install one more site on this server, and hopefully this time I can figure out why it went sideways before.

item.title: moe joe up all night working
item.description: 05:33 Thursday 16 February 2017 JST And have to wake up in 10 minutes to go to work.

item.title: yay I think I got Redmine securely installed
item.description: 23:14 Sunday 12 February 2017 JST Only reason I am not sure rests in the fact that I had to switch to LetsEncrypt –staging certs, so now my browser does not trust the site. As far as I can tell, though the SSL is installed properly. Yay! I may switch to my domain for testing again tomorrow.

item.title: fun request
item.description: 18:55 Friday 03 February 2017 JST [2/2/17, 11:25:56 AM] caught-in-middle: Hi, I updated ticket #2978. Please check when you can. ticket 2978: The code we gave you before doesn't display the page views correctly. Could you switch the code to this? Uh, yeah that’s not going to work. {{$article->title}} is obviously a placeholder. [2/2/17, 12:20:07 PM] Rob Nugen: thank you. I got it, but I need a little bit of time to test.

item.title: might install redmine
item.description: 11:10 Sunday 29 January 2017 JST Wow; I hope this script works! https://www.hiroom2.com/2017/01/22/ubuntu-16-04-install-redmine/ 12:02 Sunday 29 January 2017 JST I couldn’t get it to work. Travis replied to my plea and gave some more resources, which I hadn’t looked at before. Here is a current guide that covers your target OS: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-linux-apache-mysql-php-lamp-stack-on-ubuntu-16-04 As for Redmine, I noticed that Docker has an official Remine repository: https://hub.docker.com/_/redmine/ I see that it is based on Debian, but that is not too different from Ubuntu.

item.title: AB testing
item.description: 08:12 Tuesday 24 January 2017 JST Okay I’m going to figure out why Ghost Inspector test failed on changes I made to AB site. 08:33 Tuesday 24 January 2017 JST Aha! Uninitialized value. PHP ftw!
