Specifically, figure out why they won’t reload articles that have been updated in the RSS feed (with an expiry date in the past), after I changed the GUID of the article, after I changed its canonical URL. 12:57 Monday 23 January 2017 JST Okay, the main thing I determined:

item.title: simon
item.description: 00:36 Friday 20 January 2017 JST Via my repo to set up new Dreamhost shell account [server]$ ./password_fix.sh This script will set your password to 432 random characters if you enter your current password now: Enter your password only if you are CERTAIN you can log in without password: Okay interactively changing password. Do NOT enter anything at the next password prompt: Changing password for user. (current) UNIX password: Enter new UNIX password: Retype new UNIX password: passwd: password updated successfully if password is reported as changed, then it's now 432 random characters but I didn't keep a copy.

item.title: work deadlines
item.description: 12:26 Wednesday 18 January 2017 JST I know I didn’t say I could definitely finish. At the start of this year, they were like, “oh god the competition has ABC! We need ABC too!” yeah well ABC has been available for 6 months. Asking me to spend 8 hours to catch up to what they’ve done in as long as 6 months is not something I would have said I could do.

item.title: Started a repo which will eventually deploy Redmine to AWS
item.description: 01:29 Tuesday 17 January 2017 JST I’m creating a git repo of Ansible playbooks that I can post online to see if someone can figure it out. And this little repo gets it all started: https://github.com/thunderrabbit/bootstrap-redmine-deploy

item.title: (solved) Ansible incorrect values in usr share redmine config database.yml
item.description: 03:29 Sunday 15 January 2017 JST now it’s 3:29. fuck this I’m going to bed. for some reason I can’t figure out what command added the database config file that I want on my new server I have some old copies of the new server and on one of them the database is configured properly. But when I ran through (what I thought were) the same steps again, the database is not configured.

item.title: work
item.description: 10:49 Tuesday 10 January 2017 JST Right now I’m in a conveni across from GG class in Akihabara (formerly Akibahara). I’ve just walked here (in about 25 minutes) from the imperial gardens, during which time I talked to Chuck from online I-group. Soon I’ll teach GG’s lunch lesson for whoever usually teaches it. It’s great because they are largely self-directed; we just talk about the latest news or whatever they want to discuss.

item.title: worked
item.description: 09:32 Sunday 08 January 2017 JST Yesterday I worked on SB, trying to get Ansible to install Redmine on a server. radamanth.redmine-ansible installed a self-signed SSL key, but I couldn’t get that to work, so I manually converted the HTTPS version of the site to HTTP version. I got something to load, but it mentions a 500 error, and I can’t see anything in the log. Oh wait, after that I told the config to treat all requests as local, so it spit out the error message, something like “can’t find this function” when referencing something like use default language for anon.

item.title: back to work
item.description: 11:01 Wednesday 04 January 2017 JST Headed back to work today, by way of shopping for wallets in Kawasaki Lazona. (am almost finished with a new waterslide in minecraft world I made for Fred)

item.title: workin
item.description: 10:35 Tuesday 27 December 2016 JST Okay back to work! I gotta wanna finish work for AB before end of the year. yahooo 12:01 Tuesday 27 December 2016 JST I’ve added two (debug) lines, removed one superfluous line, and now I’m ready to write some lines that will hopefully stay for a while.

item.title: early lessons
item.description: 11:45 Wednesday 21 December 2016 JST I covered for Matt at his two lessons in Ginza. Of the seven students, I remembered Aya’s name and remember Hiroshi’s name as Hiroki. It’s been about 6 months since I taught them for the 3rd time. (Today was the fourth time.)

item.title: having Ansible install redmine

item.title: work
item.description: 17:24 Thursday 15 December 2016 JST Worked on iPhone app a bit, wiping out the paddle and balls from breakout style, and just allowed touching the bricks to destroy them. I added little explosion impulse (reverse gravity) when each brick is destroyed so it’s like they explode and blow the other bricks around the screen. func breakBlock(_ node: SKNode) { // boom simulates an explosion which affects blocks around the block let boom = SKFieldNode.

item.title: Wednesday late Thursday early
item.description: 07:48 Thursday 15 December 2016 JST My transition from Wednesday to Thursday each week includes just about 4 hours of sleep. I work until 9pm at JB (get home at 10:40pm) and then teach at 7:50 the next morning (for which I wake up at 5:49am). So I guess if I go zoom straight to sleep, I could sleep 7 hours. I’ll try that next year when the schedule resumes after the holidays.

item.title: play
item.description: 10:26 Sunday 11 December 2016 JST Party at JB school today at 1pm; gotta leave soon!

item.title: work
item.description: 10:20 Sunday 11 December 2016 JST This weekend I’ve continued working on ansible playbooks to spin up EC2 instance, update the packages, install a couple websites (these sites are why I haven’t released the playbooks), and now I’m trying to get redmine installed. I found radamanth/redmine-ansible and tried to use it. It depends on radamanth/mysql-ansible but it doesn’t work on Ubuntu 16 server. So I’m going to see if I can get sbstrm/redmine-ansible working on top of geerlingguy/ansible-role-mysql, which does work on Ubuntu 16 server.

item.title: busy work
item.description: 09:48 Friday 09 December 2016 JST Now I’m on 小田急 line to 登戸駅 where I’ll hop on the 南武線 to head to 川崎駅 where I’ll work at Wired cafe or something for a bit before meeting with Tariq at 12pm or so. Then head toward JB to buy some bananas from はしもと on the way to 3:30pm - 5:30pm class(es).

item.title: more work
item.description: 17:29 Tuesday 06 December 2016 JST In addition to fixing the functionality of a survey thing, I watched an hour of David Blaine freak people out, and nearly got my ansible thing to install a website, but it’s not working 100% due to an AJAX call returning 404 on the test system. Is it due to the fact that I’ve got the domain set to the test IP locally? Hmmm.

item.title: work
morning
item.description: 07:39 Thursday 01 December 2016 JST Lin offered to drive me to the station because it was raining. I declined her offer because it’s a waste of gas, and the rain wasn’t torrential. But even now, the fact that I declined her offer is stuck in my head. I arrived 10 minutes early for my morning lesson.

item.title: lesson
item.description: 17:27 Monday 28 November 2016 JST This morning’s lesson featured an article about something about something. Man what was it? Oh yes: Tokyo University has decided to give $300 per month to newly enrolled women in an attempt to increase enrollment. Ummmm yeah if they’re already enrolled, paying them won’t help enrollment.

item.title: work
item.description: 17:24 Monday 28 November 2016 JST Worked today with S at s and finally figured out Google Doubleclick For Providers or whatever it’s called. Basically there’s inventory and orders. Inventory has ad units and ad placements (multiple ad units). Orders have line items which have creatives. Orders can have multiple line items. Creatives are many-to-many with Line items. Creatives are basically banners or videos the end users will see as ads.

item.title: five lessons
item.description: 21:58 Wednesday 23 November 2016 JST There’s scaffolding all around the building where I taught five lessons this evening. After they were finished, I climbed on the scaffolding a little bit. I could have climbed up quite high, but chose not to for reasons of propriety. It was my first time to climb on scaffolding like this in Japan. Usually they close it off quite carefully.. but not in this case.

item.title: lesson
item.description: 09:46 Thursday 17 November 2016 JST Lesson with C and A went well; A was late (as usual), but C was on time! Amazing! I told them a bit about Pecha Kucha and how I’m nervous, ill-prepared, etc.

item.title: Work
item.description: 21:44 Wednesday 16 November 2016 JST I worked three jobs today.. not full time shifts, but I worked for 3 distinct companies. First in Akabanebashi I taught the early lesson I usually teach on Mondays, but they moved it to today for some reason. Then I went to my programming job in Ebisu where I did a tiny bit of (unpaid) work while mostly preparing for PechaKucha. Then headed to JB where I taught for five hours.

item.title: New schedules
item.description: 09:33 Thursday 10 November 2016 JST Because Lin and I moved to Shin Yurigaoka, my commute to Fukuura cost more than I was paid for travel, so I mentioned that to them and then boom new Wednesday schedule starting yesterday. Two classes were new students for me; kids classes, so it will be a good chance to get some experience with kids classes. Next week there will be 3 other classes as well; with adults, I guess.

item.title: rubber ducking in the bath
item.description: 00:42 Saturday 05 November 2016 JST While taking a bath, I just talked to Fred for 45+ minutes on the phone, rubber ducking a problem with him. Before I started working on this a couple days ago, I did the following: Save a list of indices each time the user tweaks a search on index Once a record is selected, use the indices to allow prev/next Rerun the search if they go back to the index This worked fine at first, but item #1 above now takes too much time now that the DB has grown.

item.title: one to one lesson before holiday
item.description: 21:05 Wednesday 02 November 2016 JST My group lesson had only one student; I suggested https://newsinlevels.com and https://breakingnewsenglish.com as ways she can practice extensive reading. There are probably some free sites that are actually geared toward ER, but I don’t have their domains memorized. 11:42 Saturday 05 November 2016 JST Surprise! That turned out to be my last lesson there. I had mentioned to them that it’s a bit far for me to travel and then boom they got a new teacher.

item.title: workin
item.description: 16:11 Wednesday 02 November 2016 JST Sweet; I’ve got my refactored code nearly complete. I just need to snag a copy of the number of records. I know the data already exists in DataTables; I just need to pick it up from there or maybe I already have it server-side somewhere.

item.title: lessons
item.description: 20:22 Thursday 27 October 2016 JST Lesson with A this morning was good; one-to-one because C is out of town. Not sure about K. Lessons with guides today were fine. Six back-to-back lessons in 3 hours about fun sciency topics. Lesson with GG was great; we played an “a / the” game using coins. Y got a bit confused and I was suprised about that. I think it might have been because M seems to have fibbed, but I let it go.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:22 Monday 24 October 2016 JST Oops I haven’t written in a bit. Working right now in Ebisu, from where I need to depart at 15:30 to head down past Shin Yurigaoka for a substitute lesson.

item.title: work
item.description: 10:53 Monday 03 October 2016 JST At work today I hope to fix this installation of CKEditor.

item.title: worked at home
item.description: 20:22 Friday 30 September 2016 JST Worked at home all day today, basically on Ansible. I found Ubuntu 16.04 is available on AWS as an AMI, so I switched my Ansible playbooks to use it, and then installed git, apache2, php, and apache-php-fpm (I think) because it seems to be needed to get Apache to let PHP tell it what to serve.

item.title: substitute lessons
item.description: 12:41 Wednesday 28 September 2016 JST I subbed for Matt again this week. Each class had one more student than last week, so I guess that was a good sign. I talked about neti with one of the students who was suffering from allergies. We imagined luxurious vacations in both classes. “They will fly to Italy to eat pizza” and “they would fly in a hot air balloon” are examples of the grammar structures used in each class.

item.title: work bluh
item.description: 20:08 Tuesday 27 September 2016 JST Bluh computer work kinda sucked today; I spent 5 hours on one thing and 3.5 hours on a different thing and made almost 0 progress on them. The second thing was futzing around with .htaccess file, and for 2.5 of the 3.5 hours it actually wasn’t being read. facepalm I needed to AllowOverride All in the Apache2 directives… but do I want to do that on live server?

item.title: early work
item.description: 05:18 Tuesday 27 September 2016 JST I woke up without an alarm this morning because I took a big nap yesterday, knowing that I have to wake up earlier than normal to teach a lesson for Matt who is at home in UK at the moment. Train is at 6:29, so I plan to leave the house at 6am. Better get my butt off my computer and go! Lemme just check hacker news and reddit real quick…

item.title: productive yesterday
item.description: 04:57 Tuesday 27 September 2016 JST After teaching in the morning, I pretty much spent all day playing with Ansible. I now have a vagrant installation that sets up ansible, git, and emacs on a vagrant box on my local machine which creates an ssh keypair (half of which I manually copy to bitbucket). I run setup and it pulls in a git repo and runs setup on that, which asks for an ansible-vault passphrase to unlock my AWS keys and gives me ansible playbooks which I can run to set up VPC + subnet + internet gateway on AWS, launch an ubuntu instance in the subnet, and install git on it.

item.title: work
item.description: 10:47 Friday 23 September 2016 JST I’m working with Ansible again today. I’m creating a set of three repos. One sets up a vagrant box on my local machine and then clones the second repo inside the machine. The second repo will set up VPC and subnet and internet gateway on AWS then spin up a box in a public subnet. It will clone the third repo on that box.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:07 Tuesday 30 August 2016 JST I added a little ajax action to my DataTables instance. The problem with using table.row.add was my use of Datables 1.9.4 instead of the newer 1.10.x. A-ha! Thank you, Alan!

item.title: lessons at T near Lazona
item.description: 17:21 Thursday 04 August 2016 JST Had three lessons over a two hour period at T today. Miyako , Mizuho , and Ayaka .

item.title: train work
item.description: 10:14 Tuesday 02 August 2016 JST I’m headed to work on the local train; we left 新百合ケ丘 at 10:12am. I’m not sure what time we’ll arrive in 新宿, but I have a seat, my computer, art supplies, and a snack, so I should be able to keep myself entertained until we arrive. Haha just kidding; my main concern is arriving on time, but yeah I have my computer because I had been reading at home, wondering just how long I could keep going before rushing off to my meeting on time… hey wait a minute; if I take a local train I can read while going to work.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:53 Monday 11 July 2016 JST After a bit of a break (5 days), I’m working on Ansible again today.

item.title: created security group on AWS with Ansible

'ec2_group' is not a valid attribute for a Play ERROR! ‘ec2_group’ is not a valid attribute for a Play My playbook.yml looked fine to me: - name: Create security group ec2_group: name: "test_security_group" description: "Test security group" region: "ap-northeast-1" rules: - proto: tcp from_port: 22 to_port: 22 cidr_ip: 0.0.0.0/0 - proto: tcp from_port: 80 to_port: 80 cidr_ip: 0.

item.title: lesson
item.description: 13:28 Thursday 30 June 2016 JST Lesson with K and A today featured only K at first; I told her a bit about urbit until A arrived and we talked about her semi-precious gem necklace and other stuff, including urbit.

item.title: work
item.description: 14:37 Tuesday 28 June 2016 JST Bah. My computer keeps overheating; kernel_task is hogging 700% of the CPU and I can’t get shit done.

item.title: Great GG lesson
item.description: 20:28 Thursday 23 June 2016 JST Great lesson today with GG class: we finished taking apart the 1TB hard drive, which cost just over $200 in 2009. (I thoughtlessly destroyed it with magnets; oops!) I think I net 3000 yen per GG lesson, so I got half the hard drive price back by taking it apart across three lessons.

item.title: lessons at T
item.description: 17:16 Thursday 23 June 2016 JST Lessons at T today were good; my five students all had ample questions, and I’m beginning to remember their names. It’s a bit hard because the lessons are only once every 2 weeks, and they take turns taking lessons, so I might see each of the students once a month for 45 minutes. I explained how (at current earthly understanding of physics,) a wind turbine must spin (same as aircraft wings): thick leading edge and thin trailing edge.

item.title: Workin
item.description: 16:40 Monday 13 June 2016 JST Today I had a good lesson this morning; the students really seemed keen, even taking pictures of the notes and recording my voice to use for shadowing later. Now I’m at my computer job (have been here for a bit) and just finishing up some instructions for how to set up a web server on AWS with DB on private subnet of VPC. Fun stuff even if I only understand half of it!

item.title: early fs work
item.description: 05:22 Monday 18 April 2016 JST 5am create new image of FS box cloudfront seems to be serving all CB images find, but not AB 5:15am AB images seem to be back (though server image is not complete) 5:40am started having problems getting new box to work (added it to ELB but it’s not serving images)

item.title: fake fs
item.description: 13:52 Saturday 16 April 2016 JST Today I’m making a fake FS for AB and CB (eventually) because I’m testing/practicing making a new one because AWS said they are going to boot the existing one during our prime usage time. eep!

item.title: Work
item.description: 18:21 Friday 15 April 2016 JST Been working lots and studying lots; 2 different teachers, 5 lessons per week this week. I will try a new face to face teacher on Sunday (via Jon and Paola), and see if it’s worthwhile to go somewhere instead of just doing lessons on Skype.. Been working on AB; I’ve added a quick little system that acts as a reminder for AB to contact their clients every once in a while and be like “wazaaaa” .

item.title: funny at work
item.description: 11:32 Saturday 02 April 2016 JST ubuntu$ history | grep cron 1009 sudo crontab -e 1127 crontab -e 1128 history | grep crontab 1129 sudo crontab -e 1413 crontab -e 1414 history | grep crontab 1415 sudo crontab -e 1418 sudo crontab -e 1432 crontab -e 1433 history | grep cron 1444 sudo crontab -e 1787 history | grep cron 1788 sudo crontab -e 1790 sudo crontab -e 1793 sudo crontab -e 1805 sudo crontab -e 2001 history | grep cron ubuntu$

item.title: work work workin
item.description: 12:18 Tuesday 29 March 2016 JST I’ve just moved online some code for AB to hopefully easily and smoothly correct the data that was messed up and then not corrected perfectly last week. Basically the correction assumed all values started at 0, so didn’t write 0 where it thought it didn’t need to. So this time I will set everything to 0 first before fixing the data. But the main issue is that the data is being updated on day-to-day basis incorrectly.

item.title: work data
item.description: 07:49 Monday 28 March 2016 JST HI AB! some good news: I found a mistake in the data surprising news: correcting the mistake will make the dom value even a little lower. I found a mistake in the data for unit 64935 The values are all correct all the way down through December 2015. The value of dom for January 2016 should be 0, but it listed as 43.

item.title: workin
item.description: 21:48 Tuesday 08 March 2016 JST Today I worked on CB and AB websites, making some tweaks to CB while AB tests were running. Not A-B tests, but tests on the AB site.

item.title: Work
item.description: 18:31 Tuesday 23 February 2016 JST I got three tickets done at work today. For a moment, I had a sense that I should work more diligently. The feeling passed quickly enough, but it was interesting. I got approval to have the camera guys film at the office, but then the director of the camera guys said he would just film me as a programmer at home. Oh well.

item.title: work
item.description: 08:25 Wednesday 17 February 2016 JST Worked yesterday with Satomi, finishing a ticket, starting a ticket, aborting a ticket. Working now on AB site; trying to get back into the groove.

item.title: did some work
item.description: 11:10 Saturday 30 January 2016 CST Would love to have a project manager for this thing. Three tickets for HA site, and haven’t been able to finish any of them. They require more info or send to someone else or get corrected files or determine the request was incorrectly stated.

item.title: workin
item.description: 10:34 Wednesday 27 January 2016 CST Just getting started doing some work for HN site for Nate.

item.title: First lesson in a month
item.description: 07:04 Thursday 21 January 2016 JST I’ve even forgotten what short-code I previously used for this class.

item.title: Automated testing FTW
item.description: 12:59 Wednesday 20 January 2016 JST It’s actually not automated testing FTW yet; it’s my choice to carefully go through all the tests even though I am anxious to get the changes to live server before I go on vacation FTW. I have a list of tests that I was performing manually, and am now in the process of performing them all manually just a couple more times as I teach Ghost Inspector how to do them for me.

item.title: Monday I think I was on my computer all day
item.description: (written 20:57 Thursday 21 January 2016 JST) I just noticed a gap in my recent journal entry dates.. I bet I was on my computer all day Monday… oh but I remember I slept 12 hours (!!) from 8pm to 8am after having a headache after (carrying my heavy bag to and from) the ET Contact weekend at Pyramid Meditation Center near Yanagawa station. Being on my computer all day doesn’t mean I worked all day, but probably included watching an episode of Family Guy, which I remember having done recently.

item.title: fixed a bug that I missed due to lack of testing
item.description: 18:50 Wednesday 13 January 2016 JST Oops shit. I didn’t fully test the system before putting admin server live. That shit won’t happen again because I’ve got Ghost Inspector on my side, helping me inspect the site. I’ve taught it how to test logging in, fucking up the log in, viewing the units list, and the unit edit page, as well as the group-of-units list and the group-of-units edit page.

item.title: moe joe cookies
item.description: 18:13 Tuesday 12 January 2016 JST I haven’t been able to log in to my local machine using ngrok.com because of something I haven’t probably figured out yet. Earlier today, I realized the problem must be that I’m trying to setcookie on the wrong domain, or rather, on the domain my local box sees, and not on ngrok.com. I can’t test it directly because I’m currently offline, but I tried to break the cookie here locally, but I can still log in.

item.title: Ghost Inspector 1000 tests per month yay
item.description: 12:09 Monday 11 January 2016 JST A few days ago I signed up for Ghost Inspector and thought hmmm I’d love to have 1000 tests per month instead of just 100. Boom they have that option! We're glad you're enjoying the product! Unfortunately, we don't offer any paid plans that are less than 10,000 test runs/month. However, we do have a promotion with Runscope (our parent company) where your free account will be bumped up from the 100 test runs per month on the default free plan to 1,000 test runs per month if you sign up for both services.

item.title: testing local sites
item.description: 10:27 Saturday 09 January 2016 JST I just bought an account on https://ngrok.com so I can use ghost inspector to test my local machines running on virtualbox. Sweet! I sent a couple emails back and forth with Alan who quickly solved the setup issue I was having. He showed me how I can easily use ngrok to test my site which only exists on my local virtualbox machine via a domain which only exists in my /etc/hosts file:

item.title: Learning a lot about AWS
item.description: 23:51 Tuesday 05 January 2016 JST I spoke on the phone for 1.5 hours to a guy at AWS support. He was patient, understanding, helpful, and many other things that I appreciated. He summarized the convo for me, pasted below with some parts redacted: Hi, Thanks for contacting AWS Premium Support. It was a pleasure to speak with you today in relation to the errors your clients encountered when accessing your website CB.

item.title: Automated testing is fun!
item.description: 08:25 Tuesday 05 January 2016 JST I woke up early (compared to when I went to sleep) because I had some ideas for doing automated testing. I guess there’s no harm in adding some CSS classes to make finding things easier. I may even add a click all that are unselected option if I can’t figure out how to do it with CasperJS. But first I gotta repair a script which runs every 5 minutes via cron.

item.title: Fixing a bug and setting up automagic tests
item.description: 02:51 Tuesday 05 January 2016 JST By far the large part of my time today was spent in a bit of a panic trying to figure out why the AB site was acting horribly wrong. Not even the most basic thing was working: logged in users couldn’t sort nor even filter the properties. Yikes stripes! I was really close to a major upgrade which was alllllmost working on my local system.

item.title: Moe Joe mo problems
item.description: 19:05 Tuesday 29 December 2015 JST Bah the CB website is acting up. I happen to have been in Harajuku so I’m heading in to the office now. 21:25 Tuesday 29 December 2015 JST Well, I don’t know what caused the problem, but everything seems to be working again. It happened last night for a few hours and again tonight for a few hours, so I guessed it was simply being overloaded by traffic, but Google analytics says it’s not particularly swamped right now.

item.title: workin
item.description: 17:49 Tuesday 22 December 2015 JST Today: was able to get my e-money back from Toho Cinemas after I accidentally bought Japanese dubbed Star Wars tickets last night. got some end of year fixes done for CB site, including those which they want to have done by Friday. yay! finished a ticket for AB site, though it’s not completely tested yet. (gotta test code note written in Hakyll, ya know)

item.title: Invoice template
item.description: 18:42 Tuesday 15 December 2015 JST Nate seems to have this need for things to be just the way they need to be. So for the nth time in n years, we agreed I’ll use the template he sends me to create invoices.

item.title: Got v1 of AB sortable reports done
item.description: 11:31 Wednesday 09 December 2015 JST The output columns can be sorted, but not searched. I plan to add “back to list” functionality by saving the page data on each page so it can be recreated when going back.

item.title: Finished two CB tickets
item.description: 17:00 Tuesday 08 December 2015 JST Meeting with Satomi was fine as usual. yay! We got her inbox filters fixed so she actually sees emails sent from redmine when I do updates; because those emails were skipping her inbox (and redmine folder/tag) she didn’t see when I finished things and so didn’t approve them until the next meeting. Now they can preview things and I removed the unused sharing options (Mixi, Google+, Pinterest) from the (demo) site.

item.title: Yay AB defined_report thing works for a few different reports
item.description: 16:11 Sunday 06 December 2015 JST I need to make (sure) it work(s) for reports with JOINs in the query, but at least it’s better than what it was earlier today!

item.title: working today
item.description: 21:50 Tuesday 24 November 2015 JST This morning I worked a bit on Apple TV app, but couldn’t figure out how to set the preferredFocus to the correct view. I see what the docs say, and I tried to click and drag the thing in the interface, but it simply didn’t work. Bah. I’ll skip it for now and move on to the next bit. Then at CB I increased the images on two of the site indices to be 90 by 90 pixels instead of 70 by 70.

item.title: Selenium
item.description: 19:16 Wednesday 28 October 2015 JST Speaking of (not) wasting time, I may take the time to set up Selenium and learn how to use it to test the AB site. I’ve spent a couple days testing and re-testing before doing this major change which is due Sunday.

item.title: Preview_key
today at work
item.description: 18:38 Tuesday 01 September 2015 JST Satomi came down at the perfect time; I had just finished and committed a set of changes for a new process for the AB site. They want new data added to the historical primary tables, gleaned from data in the secondary tables (basically log tables). Basically things in the primary table can be active or inactive. We have a log of when they were activated and deactivated.

item.title: breakage
item.description: 16:27 Monday 24 August 2015 JST So S-san at AB used the new function that I added, but it didn’t seem to fully work. I tested it locally so I’m not sure what’s wrong. Basically it’s supposed to edit historical data, but it didn’t seem to work for one set of tables. While looking at the historical tables to see what had changed, I found a record missing from all the tables!

item.title: AB site version 3 work
item.description: 12:23 Saturday 18 July 2015 JST Yesterday I spent a few hours working on AB site; they basically want a new login type for the frontend, so I need to restructure how the logins are processed. Basically I had put the email address in the R table because only Rs can log in to the frontend, and we need to email Rs from the backend. But now Os can also login to the frontend, and I don’t want to check two tables (because it will soon be three or four or 95) against login credentials.

item.title: AB site updates
item.description: 21:20 Monday 29 June 2015 JST Yesterday or maybe this morning I finished a relatively significant change to the AB site. Now they can edit some records which were never meant to be edited, just logged… but the logs are of human-driven changes and sometimes they have errors which need to be fixed, so they need to be fixed in the log as well. Fair enough! Then got another request to log one more thing in that log.

item.title: good shite
item.description: 18:08 Tuesday 16 June 2015 JST got some pretty good shite done at work today. S and I have set up weekly meetings and they’ve been pretty productive. Today we closed 3 tickets right off the bat (she hadn’t seen that I finished them during the week) and probably closed a couple others today. There are still some outliers I don’t know how to solve yet, but generally speaking we are making much faster progress than before (when I didn’t have meetings with her during which I can ask questions, usually some variant of “can you be more specific?

item.title: to do at work today
item.description: 10:42 Tuesday 26 May 2015 JST Figure out why proposed fix to 2613 ain’t working (and fix it) meet with S and Y get new subdomains into DNS 11:15 Finished #1 above. It turns out it was working, oops, nevermind. 15:39 actually #3 isn’t done yet, but I’ve done as much as possible for now. It’s weird. There’s a website which exists at t.example.com but it’s not shown in the list of DNS records at the example.

item.title: workin
item.description: 13:35 Wednesday 13 May 2015 JST Today for CB I did 1⁄3 of a ticket which I split into 3 tickets, primarily because they reference different websites, one of which isn’t even in the same repo. I’ll do the second ticket soon, and may have to ask Andrew for help on the third. 18:35 On the train now after having finished my lesson in Fukuura. I have alternating classes in that timeslot and I expected (and prepared for) one class, but the other class came because they had no lesson during Golden Week.

item.title: Fun day at work
item.description: 17:35 Tuesday 12 May 2015 JST Today we had a meeting that we should have held some time ago! It was the first of what I hope will be weekly meetings. なちゃん translated and we got a lot done, including translating some things that I hadn’t had translated before so couldn’t do the work! Hopefully we’ll be aable to chew through the backlog of tickets and they’ll be happy and I’ll feel helpful/productive/happy yay!

item.title: worked a bit
item.description: 16:59 Tuesday 14 April 2015 JST Finally got approval for a thing I did like 3 weeks ago, so I moved it to the live server. Then they were like, yeah but what about this: it’s not working. and showed me the URL www.example.com/report/xml um, yeah, that’s because I told you it was demo.example.com/news/xml It’s on the demo server because you haven’t approved it and it’s the news URL because that what you originally requested to be updated.

item.title: fun working day and met Scean
item.description: 18:30 Monday 13 April 2015 JST Just finished eating sakura ice cream with Scean, Kasagawa, and another guy whose name I didn’t get. We talked a lot (though I didn’t ask for permission to transcribe his interesting stories)! This was all after about 6 hours of group lessons, all coordinated from the front of the room; basically the lesson content wasn’t difficult but all the coordination took a bit of focus.

item.title: workin
item.description: 11:47 Tuesday 07 April 2015 JST I’ve essentially finished a maze today for a person on Fiverr. 12:20 Finished changes to the bodyandsoul dev site. 14:50 I made some changes to the AB website which only I can see. They asked me to estimate how long it would take and I ended up just doing it to confirm my time estimate was accurate. I added code like, “if userID == 1” to block the execution unless I’m the one logged in.

item.title: bah doing it all over again
replacing images on Body and Soul website
item.description: ##13:11 Tuesday 24 March 2015 JST## Headed in to sbstrm now to replace some images on the new Body and Soul website. Sho said there were more than he expected, but I expect I can finish them all in 4 hours before I have to leave for Mutsumi’s lesson. ##6pm 5:55 pm suddenly arrived and I was like oh fuck and ran out the door to go to the toy store on the way to Muchan’s lesson.

item.title: Workin late
item.description: ##22:43 Monday 23 March 2015 JST## Workin’ late with Sho on a new site for Body and Soul; they put on an event each year in May so we’re prepping for the announcement. I put their original site in a git repo and have their banner page on the master branch, but edits to the new site were started from a few commits back. Blarg. I agree with my decisison to start edits from a few commits back, but maybe I should have two “master” branches: one master-banner and one master-site, or something.

item.title: tonight
item.description: ##21:54 Saturday 07 March 2015 JST## Tonight I set up a repo for a site I’m supposed to temporarily replace with a full page banner ad on Monday. I think I’ll call the site BS or maybe BSJ. It’s running in csh not bash, so my preferred git log replacement looks like ass.

item.title: Added genres to CB DB
item.description: ##14:30 Saturday 21 February 2015 JST## I’ve been taking copious notes while doing updates for the CB website; Alfonzo will be moving to a new department soon so I won’t be able to bug him as much with questions. Today I finished adding the genres to the staging server.

item.title: Done did today
item.description: ##18:05 Friday 20 February 2015 JST## Recently I have been posting “Daily meditation threads” on /r/bitTippers, encouraging myself and others to take some time to sit quietly each day. The posts get about an 80% approval rate, with some people saying “wow thank you!” and some saying variants of “no way jose”. Fun stuff! Today was the fourth such thread, I think. I worked on a maze for a guy on Fiverr.

item.title: AB site testing
item.description: ##16:44 Thursday 19 February 2015 JST## Spent 6 hours working on AB site, planning for how to migrate them to their new server(s) (web + DB). That was while emailing S about some problem with server running out of memory. That ain’t good. I boosted the allowed memory in config file, but would love to figure out what the actual problem is (more precisely than there’s a lotta records!)

item.title: Great office space
item.description: ##12:30 Tuesday 17 February 2015 JST## Sweet as. I came to Wired Cafe in Atre and asked if they have an electrical outlet. Not only do they, but to use it I get to sit in a glass-wall corner overlooking Azalea and the front of Kawasaki station.

item.title: Today worked on AB DB
item.description: ##22:32 Monday 16 February 2015 JST## AB DB primarily consists of two big tables. Table U has 77k records, and 160 columns. Table B has maybe 40k records and maybe 70 columns. There’s a 1-to-many relationship from B to U. Doing joins on them takes about 3 or 4 seconds. That ain’t good, considering the joins are done all the frickin time. I guess that’s why when I got the original data, a lot of what’s now in the B table was in the U table.

item.title: Studio Soness
item.description: ##20:54 Friday 13 February 2015 JST## Full day of shooting at Studio Soness! In 8 hours, we got about 1 hour of video recorded.

item.title: Turned in my key card
item.description: ##17:09 Tuesday 13 January 2015 JST## I turned in my key card today in Harajuku. I guess I won’t be working there anymore, but they were like, “we’ll contact you.” I shan’t hold my breath.

item.title: copy database
item.description: ##12:31 Thursday 25 December 2014 JST## Copying a database over to clone the website; I’m toasting most of the data, but I think it will still work as a demo site.

item.title: actual work
item.description: ##Monday 8 Dec 2014 (written 10:38 Tuesday 09 December 2014 JST) I spoke with Nate and Alfonzo yesterday about work stuff; Alfonzo has been too busy to do it so I may get a chance to make a few extra dollars. The contract may be terminated though, not sure yet. This is for the CB project we started six years ago. They’ve been on a “maintenance” contract but asking for lots of changes.

item.title: Meeting with Nate
item.description: ##16:24 Tuesday 04 November 2014 JST## Speaking with Nate before I go to teach M&M in Harajuku tonight. JB emailed and asked if I can work for them 3 days over the next week and a half.

item.title: Started Phase 3 of AB website
item.description: ##4pm Wednesday 29 Jan 2014 JST## Just finished meeting with Tomomi and Sho about phase three of their website. I’m thankful that Tomomi took into consideration the existing technologies we’ve used on the site when planning how to do the next steps. My next steps are to create some rough mockups and estimate time required to make the changes.

item.title: lawnchair to solve a different thing at work
item.description: ##19:27 Wednesday 08 May 2013 7:10pm Wednesday 8 May 2013 I was thinking recently how I didn’t use lawnchair to keep track of which items were on a page when coming back to it. But today I did use lawnchair for a different thing, mostly because I was already using lawnchair for a similar issue. There’s a page which uses Datatables to display lists of units in the system. When clicking to view a particular unit, there are previous and next buttons on the page.

item.title: yesterday at work
item.description: ##06:43 Wednesday 08 May 2013 6:38am Wednesday 8 May 2013 Yesterday at work I got the pagination to be ajax driven if javascript is enabled and GET driven if javascript is not enabled. I’ve started to cut a couple corners as the project is a bit overdue. For example, instead of figure out how to redisplay the same units when clicking back to the map page (I’d probably use Lawnchair), I just open units in a new tab.

item.title: ajax at work
item.description: ##08:00 Friday 26 April 2013 7:04am Friday 26 April 2013 I found some code online in Perl that showed an awesome fast way to do clustering of pins on a map. I’ll probably post the code on SO where many people have been asking how to do it. That might make up for the points I lost yesterday by asking a question. When a map marker is clicked, I load the units associated with it via ajax.

item.title: good day at work
item.description: ##21:45 Wednesday 10 April 2013 8:57pm Wednesday 10 April 2013 Pretty good day; our new server on AWS had been barfing hourly errors like, “the MySQL server has gone away” or “could not connect to mySQL server” even though 99.n% of the connections were fine. We had been using MySQL 5.6, and certainly I may not have had it set up right. Once I instantiated a server with 5.5 (and reverted the DB to MyISAM tables for those with FULLTEXT indices), it has worked perfectly fine.

item.title: new server for AB
item.description: ##10:57 Saturday 30 March 2013 10:55am Saturday 30 March 2013 Came in to work today to move AB from server which we didn’t totally control to one which we control a lot more. We still don’t have to touch the hardware, but now we have sudo access as needed. The move was smooth; the longest part was waiting for DNS to update.

item.title: closed some redmine tickets
item.description: ##21:48 Monday 07 January 2013 I found an slow, but easy way to close redmine tickets. Today I asked about some that have been lingering from the beginning of the project, and Shirata-san said those features are no longer needed. Nice(?)

item.title: notes to self on the final day of the world
item.description: ##18:43 Friday 21 December 2012 because Monday is a holiday, I figure my brain will need some notes to reload its current state. Some notes on my desk point to a URL that will result in the notes here, spewed out by code in progress: in code above line 64, we need to fill in the default email from site_text factory (into array shown below) Array ( [renter_id] => 23 [to_name] => doug e fresh [to_email] => doug@e.

item.title: working on front end's back end
item.description: ##22:50 Monday 10 December 2012 The AB project has classes I created a year ago, at which time were the next iteration of our in-house framework. Six months ago we created the next iteration, which handles multi-lingual sites a bit more elegantly. So now the AB project’s front end will be using the new classes while the back end is still on the old classes. But the front end has some classes in the back end so they can make updates to the public facing site.

item.title: news at work
item.description: ##21:27 Thursday 06 December 2012 We’ll be moving soon, though haven’t yet confirmed our new place. Hopefully it will be near The Pink Cow in Roppongi, so I’ll be able to hang out there a bit more easily. In other news, I’m getting the reporting engine a bit more completed.

item.title: pushed 72 commits to github
item.description: ##15:36 Wednesday 05 December 2012 So sad that it’s all closed source, but I just pushed the first version of the reporting system to our client’s admin site. It uses backbone to do most of its goodness, including: add fields for filtering, add fields for output, run the report, and copy the report for more reporting fun!

item.title: I wanna know how to asynchronously save selections in a multiselect dropdown
item.description: ##15:12 Wednesday 28 November 2012 So I asked this question on SO: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13598834/detect-select-status-of-options-in-a-multiselect-with-backbone-picky There may be a slick way to do it without Backbone.Picky; it’s curious that Derick hasn’t touched Backbone.Picky in 6 months (since May 2012).

item.title: workin on my backbone
item.description: ##21:45 Tuesday 27 November 2012 Today at work I stopped trying to convert my code into a Marionette app; I just don’t seem to have enough smerts to do it yet. I’m gonna try again tomorrow, making a Marionette app from scratch. Well, from a semi blank js slate, so hopefully it will go a bit more easily. The code I’ve got so far uses Backbone to do some pretty sweet ajax compared to writing all the ajax queries in jQuery.

item.title: Insanity at work
item.description: 10:05am JST Saturday 27 September 2003 Well, it may be coming to an end. Monster-good-stories may be coming soon. Greetings Robert, My name is M____. Through a very convoluted path of rumors and faxes I found your website by request of my Japanese wife. Journal entry 12:19 am JST Friday 26 September 2003 is making its rounds! Apparently there is a pissed off mother who ready your message and interpreted it as unprofessional.

item.title: work
item.description: 8:20pm Friday 30 June 2000 I’ve essentially started over my generic survey project. My goal this time is to make it so generic that we can just drop information into about 20 variables and a few datasets and bang. New survey. So far I’ve gotten the first page 1⁄3 of the way finished. Great job, Rob! Tonight hopefully Wende and I are going to watch a movie. We might also see Chicken Run tomorrow morning!

item.title: Work
item.description: 6:45am CDT Friday 23 June 2000 Yesterday at work seemed strange because literally I didn’t have a project that needed attention. Two projects are on hold as we wait for further information from our clients. Yay! So I began working on some generic macro type things that will hopefully allow us to code more efficiently on future projects. Since I’m beginning to get a better grasp on SAS and how it can be used (and how we use it at work), this is pretty much the first time I’ve been able to do this.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:15am CDT Thursday 22 June 2000 Work “today” was unique in that I actually caught up with all the projects. By this I mean that there was no more SAS programming to be done until we hear more from our clients. Wow! I transcribed some 1991 journal entries, recognizing that I’m more inspired to do so now that Molly has offered to help. :-) Tomorrow at work we will celebrate Kevin’s birthday!

item.title: work
item.description: 5:48pm Thursday 15 June 2000 So I’m working now on a project I’ll call the DTRU Project (If I refer to the KTRU Project, it’s probably a type-o). DTRU Project is a subset of the Big Monster Project that I had been working on for months. I have been commenting out huge sections of code that I think we will eventually need as the DTRU project experiences Feature Creep, but for now, it does not need.

item.title: Work
item.description: Work 6:31pm CDT Tuesday 9 May 2000 A couple of interesting things at work today: With some help from Kevin, I rewrote a screen on our big project. This screen is called rateWho; it displays a list of names for whom an individual may provide feedback. Originally, I designed the screen so that if a person had missed the time-frame to rate someone, that someone’s name would not show up.

item.title: Work2
item.description: Work 11:33pm CDT Tuesday 9 May 2000 Ack. I just got a call from Kevin. He booted our webserver tonight and it's not coming back up. After it checks the memory, finds the disks, gets past the "press spacebar to use last known good configuration", it flashes error codes and restarts. I'm going in to work now. 3:45am CDT Wednesday 10 May 2000 Sure enough, when I arrive the server was still rebooting itself as described above.

item.title: Workin
item.description: 9:30am CDT Sunday 30 April 2000 Wende is at work all day today (9am to 7pm) and I intend to do a lot around the house. I’ve sent out The Feel Good Net, and wrote a letter to Karen. Now for the house, I’m going to Home Depot to purchase some motor “dimmer” switches for our ceiling fans so we can control their speed from the wall outlet! I also plan to flea-spray my old bed (which has been quarantined in the garage since I moved my junque two weeks ago) and move it to the guest bedroom.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:48pm Tuesday 28 March 2000 Both of my bosses are pausing for lunch today, which means the work load is manageable, and therefore I will likely get to meet with them about full timeliness and maybe DSL at me and Wen’s new house! Honestly, I think the prospect of them paying for DSL is pretty good; it’s relatively inexpensive and will allow me to work from home on projects and problems.

item.title: work
item.description: 9:33pm CST Monday 27 March 2000 Probably the coolest most imminent unknown in my life is around work: I’m going to be meeting with my bosses tomorrow to discuss me shifting to a full time position, with paid medical benefits! The unknown part is my salary. How much do I want? How much do I think I’m worth? I can start by calculating my hourly wage out to 40 hours per week.

item.title: work
item.description: 7:28am CST Wednesday 22 March 2000 I’ll call it lovely synchronicity, and not manic work work work to make money for the new house. Yesterday I worked 14.5 hours to complete my portion of the SAS project, then handed it over at 9pm to my boss to do the rest. This version of the project goes into production today as a pilot for a small group of people before we set the masses of users loose on it.

item.title: coding
item.description: 12:07pm Tuesday 21 March 2000 I’ve been working diligently for the past 4.5 days on this SAS stuff, and my SAS brain is getting pretty smart (I think). Yesterday I wrote my most complex SAS program ever - it merges datasets, creates datasets dynamically, updates the datasets on disk according to user preferences.. Good nerdy computer stuff. There are a couple of things I still haven’t been able to figure out - some aspects of writing a new row to dataset, and keeping track of iterations… simple in concept, but I just don’t know the syntax.

item.title: work1
item.description: Work 3:30pm CST Friday 17 March 2000 (transcribed from my diary) Today I'm working on a big ol' SAS project and I've drwan out flow charts on my big sheets of paper. (big = 25.5" X 11" (from Scholars' Community at UH)). Work flow is good; project is due mid next week. I'm working on it tomorrow too and maybe Sunday. Missing Centex (Ultimate tourney in Austin) to work. 6:20pm CST Friday 17 March 2000

item.title: trauma
item.description: 6:41p wednesday 8 march 2000 ACK All day I’ve been doing great coding here at work (all day after KTRU) and then I was asked to reboot a machine. I rebooted it properly I thought, but turns out I mis-chose one of the startup options. Ack ack ack ack 30 minutes in mental agony standing behind my boss as he tried to figure out how to fix it. I had no idea how to help, AND I’m supposed to be somewhere at 6:30.

item.title: workin
item.description: 5:49pm Tuesday 7 March 2000 Welp, Wende and I looked at the little house across the street. I thought it was cool, but she found the bedrooms to be too small, and it had an extra garage thingy converted to a dog/cat grooming salon. She felt it would be wasted space, and realistically, she’s right. We requested from Diane our credit ratings, to see what kind of loan we could get and stuff like that.

item.title: work
item.description: 12:43pm Sunday 5 March 2000 Heh. That’s funny. I just realized I wrote February for the previous entry instead of March. I’m at work now, designing a desk addition thing that will allow me to clear of the cluttery crap from my desk. Papers, books, pictures, hard drive, fork, plate, water bottles, grocery bag, CDs, glue stick, floppy disks, telephone, binder, tools, paper paper paper all clutter my desk now. I believe that if I had more place to put it all, I could keep the desk surface less covered in crap so I could actually use my desk for things like writing or coloring or something.

item.title: work
item.description: Work work work 9:01pm CST Thursday 2 March 2000 Today I basically worked all day. Woke up crazy early and decided therefore to do laundry!! Two great things about that: My laundry is now complete! I found Wende’s Sacagawea dollar! I had left her new dollar coin in my shorts pocket. Now we know what they will look like after a nice laundering. Not brilliant shiny, but still golden in color.

item.title: work
work-etc
item.description: 22 December 1999 Wow. 3 days till Christmas; 10 days till 2000!! Today at work I finalized purchase orders for three machines!! This is a first for me on this scale, and with this level of precision piece by piece construction. The data server will be a dual PIII 500 mhz machine with 256meg ram, four 9.1gig hard drives (scsi ultra 2, 10,000 rpm) arranged into a RAID 5 array with a hot spare, single channel raid controller that can handle 15 physical drives, 8 gig tape backup, two NIC 10⁄100 cards, dual power supply in a big tower case with 12 drive bays, etc.

item.title: work late
item.description: 1:35am I logged 11 hours today, 9 of which go to DSL switchover. Was not able to get the mail server happy. We can receive email, but not send it; the mail server thinks our new IP addresses are hackers trying to use our server as a mail relay. (This is a technique used to spam people; our server won’t allow it.) I don’t know where to add our IP addresses and say, “hey!

item.title: work
item.description: Yay! Great fun at work today; got to learn some new SAS stuff. I pretty much don’t like the language - it’s not strictly structured like C, sloppy variable typing and sloppy function calls. but I can handle it! Oh, and the best thing of all- I asked if I could be paid today for the past week of work instead of waiting until next official payday, and Karla was like, “no problem!

item.title: work praise
item.description: I really love my job. I just got this message from my boss. —–Original Message—– From: Karla (Rob’s boss) Sent: Thursday, December 02, 1999 4:23 PM To: Rob Nugen Subject: Good job! It gives me great reassurance to overhear you talking with the tech people at Savvis as well as other places. You sound confident and you know what you are talking about. Thanks for working with us. K.

item.title: laundry work
item.description: 7 october 1999 Today it was decidedly cold when I woke up! I’ve been sleepin’ with only a sheet for the past some weeks, and my bedroom window is open so Spot can get in and out via his tree. But this morning I woke up and brrrr! It was like 60 degrees! I couldn’t find my comforter in my sleepy state, so I grabbed my sleeping bag and recuddled myself up for a bit.

item.title: work
item.description: 2:53PM Thursday Dec 26, 1991 (transcribed from Book Two of my diary) I'm at home for lunch right now. I parked at a parking meter under Pierce Elevated. I put enough money in for 9 hours. When I went to lunch, so that no one could use my time, I put a brown bag that said, "Out Of Order" over the meter. Pretty sneaky... I got a picture of Joy today.
